Reviews.Title: “Too bad on our time”
Reviews.Author: Needheat
Reviews.Content: Got in February 29 Lanai was getting retiled, repairs took longer than expected which took away from our time, but oh well. Would of rated higher if we didn't lose the lanai for a week. Rented our unit through MauiOwners.com not the El Dorodo so we were pretty much stuck with the unit. Great unit though, great view, great location, lots of newer stuff in unit. Some of the units are getting dated, but a number of units including the one I had are investing some money in their investment. All staff were great Jeffrey, Pam, thanks. Pam is great to book tours through and also makes great sandwiches. Cabanna can be tricky to get a chair, they do that caribean thing though, put towels over the chairs to hold them then show up whenever. Went down early one day so I could be there when it opened to put towels over a couple of chairs for me. Got there 20 minutes before there was supposed to be any towels handed out yet. Imagine my surprize to find ten chairs already taken with towels issued from the Cabanna. (something fishy going on here) Great place though would not hesitate to go back, now that I know a few of the tricks the reguliars pull off. Make sure to buy some groceries at costco when in Kahalui, can get expensive to eat out all the time, but it is Maui. Hope to return soon, mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every second!”
Reviews.Author: ErinandCraig123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for our honeymoon in December. We were a bit worried at first when we pulled up to the room as it looked a bit dodgy from the outside however, we were pleasently surprised when we opened the door. The room was very spacious, clean and modern looking. It had a fully equipped kitchen, seperate lounge room and bedroom as well as washing facilities. We booked a partical ocean view room with a lanai. We didn't really have any views except of a pool and frangipani tree. It is a long walk down to the cabana so I recommend calling reception to take you down their in a golf cart. The only downsides were that the shower and toilet area were a bit small but managable and the view was a little less than expected. Otherwise I highly recommend this hotel. The staff and friendly and helpful and you can see why people keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger Eldorado Great Choice in Maui”
Reviews.Author: spitzy135
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Maui at the Outrigger Eldorado. We were looking for someplace moderately priced for our 7 day stay, and the Eldorado completely blew us away. These are 8 unit/2 story building condos set in the middle of the Kaanapali Golf Course. We booked a Studio Garden View, which is their least expensive room, and were delighted with our accommodations. It looked just like the picture online. It was very spacious, quiet, beautifully decorated, and equipped with a fully loaded kitchen, washer and dryer, and a dining/sitting area. We could just make out the ocean from our lanai, and were steps away from one of their 3 pools. The grounds are meticulously cared for and are filled with gorgeous tropical flowers, trees and bushes. When we first arrived, we had a problem with our lanai door which was stuck and wouldn’t open. The hotel staff was very efficient and took care of it promptly. Even though it is a condo, they have housekeeping services that come in daily to make the bed, replace towels, tidy the bathroom, and replace coffee if requested. The Eldorado was perfect for us. We didn’t want a small cramped expensive hotel room. Here we had all the comforts of home, and had breakfast in our condo. We bought groceries at the Safeway in the Lahaina Cannery Mall. This saved a few bucks plus we didn’t have to get up as early to go out to eat. And it was convenient to be able to do a load of wash during our 11 day Hawaii stay. We are not beach enthusiasts, so having a nice comfortable place to stay in between our tourist excursions was great. But if you do like the beach it is still very doable. The beach and Whalers Village is a ten minute walk from the condo, but they will drive you to the cabana on the beach in one of their golf carts. If you do walk down to the beach during the day, there is a shortcut through the back using the golf paths; just make sure you don’t walk on the golf course itself. This avoids the big hill you need to walk down, and then up on the way back if you go out the front. At night it isn’t advisable, since the golf course is not lighted and the paths are too dark to walk. There is also a trolley that you can catch starting at 10:00AM. I thought Whalers Village was going to be some small strip mall with a few restaurants. It is a beautiful upscale multilevel mini mall with a Sephora and a Rolex store! It also has an ABC store, which are ubiquitous in Hawaii as you will find out. It also has a food court with some small local vendors that serve great less expensive sandwiches and breakfasts, along with a McDonalds and a Subway. It also has three sit down restaurants located right on the beach. We had a few dinners at Leilani’s and highly recommend it. Make sure you save room for a piece of Hula pie. They are one of a few restaurants that serve it in Hawaii, and it is one of the best desserts you will ever eat! As far as location, these Eldorado condos are located in a quiet section of Kaanapali, near the Sheraton, Whaler and Royal Lahaina. We liked this location a lot more than the area to the north, which is more congested, and much better than the Kihei area. Kihei in south Maui feels residential with tons of condos, time shares and strip malls. If you didn’t see the palm trees you’d think you were in some mainland city housing complex. In addition, the parking at the Eldorado is one if the least expensive at $7/day, and they do not charge a resort fee. Be careful with parking in Maui. Honestly, I believe it is a major source of income for the island! If you park in the Whalers Village ramp, make sure you purchase something at one of the stores to get your parking validated, otherwise you’ll be in for a hefty parking fee. Parking is not free in Lahaina either. We parked in the Lahaina Center parking lot on Papalaua St. We purchased inexpensive items at the ABC store there, and they validated our parking. You must purchase items only in the Lahaina Center stores for the parking validation, since other stores in Lahaina do not participate. Then we walked through the shops and restaurants in Lahaina. It’s a great place for some historic walks, food and great shopping. There is a gentleman there who will take pictures of you and your family with his colorful parrots, and don’t miss Ululani’s Shaved Ice. We booked all of our reservations through Maui Kay at www.mauikay.com. She is located right in Maui, and we highly recommend her. She had great inside information about the island and was terrific to work with. We contacted her mostly by e-mail since there is a 5 hour time difference from NY. Also check out Jon Blum’s site at http://www.mauihawaii.org/ . He also lives in Maui and is a great source of inside info about Maui. They both have free monthly newsletters which helped a great deal in planning our 2 week Hawaiian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Sharalyn P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at your beautiful facility in February, actually our family rented 4 different units, can't say enough great things about the Maui Eldorado. What fabulous staff !!!! Pam, the events co-ordinator was super, she helped us with golfing, zip line and cruising. Wonderful views and imaculate ground. We had an older but well maintained unit, all 4 that we rented were of varying size and upgrades. We were very fortunate to have wonderful neighbours for our entire stay also. When we return to Maui we would certainly stay there again, location is very central and loved the private cabanas. Would definately recommend the Maui Eldorado.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the El Dorado”
Reviews.Author: odiefamily
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Great location, quick 5 minute walk to beach or 10 minute walk to Whalers Village. We stayed in a 1 bd/2bath partial ocean view unit booked thru Outrigger. It was beautifully updated and huge. It was just myself and husband but we could have easily fit the kids in there too. Daily housekeeping was a huge bonus along with the beach cabana that is reserved for El Dorado guests only. It was so convenient to be able to walk to shopping, restaurants, and the beach!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: sm8ckd0wn1
Reviews.Content: The Outrigger Maui Eldorado is located about 150 yards away from the Kaanapali beach. The hotel itself, is older, though the room we had was newly renovated which was great. The room also had a full kitchen. The place was surrounded with different types of people, from young and older couples to families with their children. The service was good--one night our TV remote stopped working so we made a call to the front desk. Less than 5 minutes later, we heard a knock and an attendant was there to drop off some new batteries! The area was very quiet at night which we quite enjoyed! There was not much of a night life in the Outrigger but then again, there's not much night life in Maui period! We enjoyed our stay stay and may consider the Outrigger again for the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, beautiful vacation”
Reviews.Author: KML87
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado. We were in D100, and loved the location of the condo and the room ammenities. We enjoyed the full kitchen, laundry facilities and the large rooms. I appreciated the rides down to the beach, especially when carrying lots of stuff. The cabana was clean, and well stocked. The grounds were immaculate! I would definiately stay here again. The Outrigger Maui Eldorado is highly recommended from me.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: ekh9
Reviews.Content: My first thought about Maui Eldorado is that there must be great inconsistency in the condition of the units. Some of the reviews are fantastic, but our unit was not in good condition. It was actually somewhat disgusting. The entire unit needed painted (about 10 years ago) and baseboard work. We had water damage is both bathrooms and the bedroom. The tubs were missing large sections of porcelain and there were tiles missing and cracked everywhere. Counters were mildewed and missing tiles. Kitchen was just kind of old and yucky. The air conditioner unit in the bedroom was right above the bed and so loud and clanky we turned it off to sleep. Our deadolt didn't work, bathroom sink didn't drain and no lightbulb in outside doorway. On the plus side, the area was fantastic. We had a beautiful, large balcony with a view of the golf course and the ocean. It was amazing to sit out and view the scenery. We loved the cabana and beach area. The pool area was big, but very cold. Overall, we would not stay here again, unless we got one of the great units that other people seem to review favorably. So beware what you may end up with. By the way we were in the building closest to the lobby and room 204.

Reviews.Title: “Could live in this condo!!”
Reviews.Author: mauilover0517
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. It was wonderful! My husband & I shared a 2BR/2BA condo with my Mom & Dad. We had unit B100. At first we were disappointed to be near the road & far away from the beach. But our disappointment turned to joy when we saw the inside of the unit. You know how the brochure or online pictures are normally the most beautiful unit & noone actually gets a room that looks like the picture? Well we got it! It was perfectly appointed, clean & modern. The walk from our unit to the beach cabana took less then 10 minutes in flip flops. We did take the golf cart back about half the time & while not required we tipped the driver a couple of bucks for the service. We only swam in one of the 3 pools. The large one on top of the parking garage. The middle pool was a little small & cold and we just never made it to the 3rd one which was actually the closest to us. Pool towels prvided in your room, beach towels at the cabana. The cabana deck was awesome! Loved having a fridge to put our beverages in. The cabana also checks out beach chairs in case the deck is full or the sun isn't on the deck yet. Sun started hitting the deck about 11am. Minor issues that could have been better; need more hangers in the closet, no fan in the bathroom to remove steamy air, tile floor needed mopping & the carpet might need shampooing because our feet or socks got dirty if we weren't wearing shoes inside. Small parking areas near the units fill up fast so you can expect to park in the garage & walk to your unit. Loved eating at Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina. A short 10 min drive South & liked the Times Supermarket about 5 min North better than the Safeway in Lahaina. Also loved picking up the plumeria that fell from the trees to bring back to our unit for decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Rough start----- great finish!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bob e
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Maui and our first stay at the El Dorado. We took another couple with us and rented a two bedroom condo. We checked in late and was assigned a condo in the D building which backs up to a busy road. It just did not work for us.The next morning I voiced my concern to the front desk and also the management.They acknowledged my concern and went to work finding more suitable accomodations.All their two bedrooms were booked for the rest of our stay but they were able to show us three studios that were available.We took one in the A building and the other couple took one in the E building.Even though we were not together it still worked out great.I want to thank the staff and the management for a wonderful stay and for going the extra mile for us,we really appreciated it.We look forward to coming back.Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facility But Dated”
Reviews.Author: Russell372
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the El Dorado from 2/2-7 with my daughter and myself. We stayed in a garden studio (J111). We found the grounds very nice and hotel staff most accommodating. The unit we were assigned needs some updating and maintenance, ie peeling wall paper, worn cabinets, etc. Stayed in Wailea last year in a condo complex (which was far better than this condo) for similar cost per night (but quite a bit more this year) so opted to try the El Dorado. It is okay for a okay price. Maybe other units are maintained better.

Reviews.Title: “"Our" island home-truly”
Reviews.Author: NYNorthcoasters
Reviews.Content: It is better than before. Everything that has made us return year after year to this property is still valid and there has been a great addition since last winter. We called it "Pam Sandwiches". Pam has added a cold kitchen to her convenience store-tour desk and now makes fresh sandwiches to order that reasonably price. She will deliver them right to you at the pool or beach cabana along with other refeshemnts. For the warm greeting by name and big "aloha" when we got there to the parting "aloha" when we left by the staff. Mahalo! We truly are treated like "owners" by the staff and the real owners .If you want a quiet, well run, island stay with a great beach, sun, rainbows, in the middle of a great golf course withd the Maui aloha spirit, try "our island home". Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Third stay, great time again”
Reviews.Author: puma123
Reviews.Content: We love this place! This time we got a good rate on a 1 bedroom unit - wow, what a difference from a studio! So much more room and space - was nice I could hit the hay if my husband wanted to stay up and watch TV in the other room. That being said, we have always been pleased with the studios - plenty of room there, too. As always, the place was clean, up-to-date, great housekeeping, friendly front desk staff, great location. Fully stocked kitchen. Pool was never crowded, always found a place to lounge in the afternoons. You have your own lanai to relax on. Great place - really - if you want a condo with all the amenities - this place has never disappointed us! We use it as a home base to go scuba diving - if you want to spend all day at the beach, though, there is a nice beach closeby (it is a 5 minute or less walk, or a free golf cart ride). Stay here and enjoy Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, peaceful, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: KristiePlus3
Reviews.Content: My room was large, comfortable and clean, with a great patio right on the golf course and distant ocean view. Full kitchen, washer and dryer, large closet, all for a great price. Walk to the beach was only about 10 minutes away along the golf course - no need to cross busy streets. If you're looking for a fun place for kids, this isn't it - the pools are small and simple, nothing fancy, and most of the residents were grandparent ages - but for peace and quiet and privacy, this place can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Donald R
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Outrigger Maui Eldorado and found it excellent. The condo [B203] was large, clean, well furnished, and had a nice [partial ocean] mostly golf course view. The staff friendly and helpful. The grounds were inpeccable. The seaside cabana was great and we brought an elderly couple along and used the golf cart shuttle often but it is only a 10-12 minute pleasant walk. You can also order lunch from the cabana at a fair price [very handy] or bring your own and use the amenities there. You do hear the traffic from this apt. but not much after 10:00 pm. We had trouble closing one of the windows so it's a small problem that could be fixed. The parking after supper was often full but you can park across the street or use the underground parking. All things considered I would still give it a 5. Plan to go back and bring a golfing friend next time.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were more than adequate and great view”
Reviews.Author: Janey10_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a condo and we were very happy with the place. Everything worked and was super clean. What ever we need was already provided in the room. Our condo overlooked the golf course with a partial ocean view that was stunning. Would go back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Nice Amenities for Families”
Reviews.Author: CocoRee
Reviews.Content: The room was a little dated but very spacious - a very comfortable couch to sleep on even without pulling it out. Nice lanai to sit outside and eat breakfast on. It had a ktichen and a washing machine that definitely came in handy. There is a deli that is right next to the hotel where you can get a cheap breakfast and a box lunch (with a cooler) to take on the road to Hana (one meal is good enough for 2 people btw). This hotel is on Ka'anapali beach but about a mile in walking distance from the Whalers Village. It is great for people who have families because it has a nice beach house right on the water that has towels, an outdoor shower, and a kitchen (for families that would like to cook while on the beach instead of having to leave and spend $$$). You can't walk to the Whaler's Village along the beach - there is a river/creek and a jetty that prevents this. However, you can walk about 0.5 miles down the street to get there - which isn't a big deal (or a bad walk). Overall this hotel was great for the price - it was a nice location in reference to Napili/Kapalua and the Lahaina area. I stayed at the Outrigger in Lahaina last time and it seems that Outrigger always has reliable service and a great quality of rooms. Great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Aging gracefully”
Reviews.Author: theseatsaretooclose
Reviews.Content: While it doesn't have the flash of a fancy resort, the Eldorado features clean and spacious condos with well equipped kitchens if you want to avoid having to eat out every night. Since the units are owned by private parties and rented out by Outrigger Hotels, the quality of the rooms does vary. However, I've been staying at the Eldorado for thirty years now off and on and rarely have had reason to complain. If you want umbrella drinks by a pool with waterfalls, or valet parking and concierge service - this is not your place (The Sheraton just down the street should suit you just fine). These are 35 year old two story condo 'blocks' that look pretty much the same on the outside as they did the first time I stayed there, but have been updated time and again on the inside - don't let the external appearance fool you. The studios are perfect for couples, and even the ones up next to the lobby (just off the main road) are quiet. The rooms are a short 5 minute walk from what amounts to a private beach with cabana facilities (showers, bathrooms, etc...), and you can order food and drinks to be delivered from the mini-mart in the hotel lobby. I considered staying in a hotel again this time, but switched back to the Eldorado which proved to be the right choice. FYI - Put those kitchen facilities to good use. 'Foodland Farms' in the newer strip mall across from the older Lahaina Cannery Mall, is West Maui's answer to Whole Foods. Great selection of specialty foods (wines, chocolates, cheeses), steaks, seafood, and several kinds of poke made fresh daily!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ChuckandKathy
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time to Maui but our first time staying here. We stayed in E205. We loved everything about this place. Pools and grills by the big pool all kept clean and in working order. Our studio was perfect and had EVERYTHING we needed. They even provided laundry detergent and Salt and Pepper which I had brought. We loved the cabana area and it was nice to catch the golf cart for a ride back to the lobby after swimming all day. Parking was extra, at $7.00 per day, but cheaper than most. We will definately come back here again. Best value for the money, We loved having the washer and dryer. We only did carry- on luggage. A few shorts, shirts and bathing suit and snorkel equipment was all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: GreenGazoo
Reviews.Content: An excellent property for the price. Although it looks like it was built in the early 70's, it is well maintained, clean, and has an attentive staff. The location was excellent and we very much enjoyed the beach which was a short walk on a paved pathway. The housekeeping was minimal and parking costs extra. There was free cable internet.

Reviews.Title: “We the best time in Maui”
Reviews.Author: PartyMan_11
Reviews.Content: We came to Maui for the Maui Invitationals. We arrived late so the security man had to check us in. Prior to our trip to Maui we called the resort and I spoke with Tamara and she made my trip so much fun before we got to Maui. She sold the Eldorado as if she was a realtor. Me and my buddy could not wait to get there. A very sweet soft spoken lady, I think her name is Maryann, checked us in the next morning. She was terrific and so imformative. I was able to meet Tamara and she took the time to give us a tour around the property for a short time. I can't wait for our next trip to Maui ... I will definitely return to Maui Eldorado! Thank you Tamara and staff for an awesome time in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Large Condo”
Reviews.Author: patricksonline
Reviews.Content: We liked our 1 BR condo on the golf course. Walk to ocean about one block. Pools were nice and clean. Beach was nice. Fully equipped kitchen. Extra daily $8 for parking. I would stay here again. Housecleaning marginal but call to front desk fixed those few issues.

Reviews.Title: “Chose carefully!”
Reviews.Author: klemintyne
Reviews.Content: My extended family has been staying here for more than 30 years. We love the location and the facility, in general. Its perfect for families. However, when you check in, INSIST upon inspecting your accommodations thoroughly, first. Not all condos are equal! Some are plainly, deplorable. We had 4 condos between 4 families and three were exceptional (G106, J105 and D106). However, F103 was past it's prime and had lots of problems. We DID inspect it, however, we wish we'd been more thorough. We'll come back, but we will be very selective.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mgirrl
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui on multiple occasions, but this is our first time staying at the Outrigger. We really enjoyed it. The condo that we had was very spacious, a huge bedroom, living room and 2 complete bathrooms. The lanai was awesome. It was the length of the condo, with 2 chaise lounges and a table for 4. The bed was very comfortable too. We used the kitchen for breakfast and lunch. We also used the washer and dryer. Everything worked great. We overlooked one of the pools and had an ocean view. Our condo was close to the road that runs in front of the Outrigger, and was inititally worried about road noise, but once inside the condo, we never noticed it. We used the cabana that is down by the beach. They offered towels and chairs for the beach, which we took advantage of. We usually walked down there, but you can take the carts back and forth as well. We got help at the activity desk with recommendations for eating, snorkling and trips. They were very helpful. I really liked the location as well. Close to everything, but not right in the middle of more crowded areas. There's a small strip mall close by with a great coffee shop too. I guess I don't have anything but nice things to say. We would absolutely recommend! And, if visiting Maui again we will definately be staying at the Outrigger!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Friendly Hotel - Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: EmilyandSam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Eldorado and let me first say that this is probably the best deal for the money you'll find on Maui! The rate was good ($155/night for a Studio with partial ocean view, but this was slightly discounted as it was with a wedding group), and we were upgraded to a 1-bedroom which was HUGE... I think it was bigger than the last place we lived! It had two full bathrooms, a well-equipped full kitchen, separate living room, master bedroom, and GIGANTIC deck with dining table and lounge chairs. It was immaculately clean, and service was friendly. All units have W/D which is really nice. Parking is $7/day and wi-fi is included. The beach access isn't bad, with a 5 minute walk down to the beach (or a quick call will give you a golf cart ride to the cabana), but it's not as easy as just walking out your door and onto the beach. I know a lot of it depends on which room you stay in as they are individually owned, but the property seems to lack the Hawaiian charm we've found elsewhere. You can walk down to Black Rock for snorkeling, but we found significantly better snorkeling in South Maui (Kihei/Wailea/Makena areas). We also liked the beaches better in South Maui. I think that the Maui Eldorado would be an excellent choice for families who want the amenities of a kitchen, washer/dryer, more space, and to take the kids to the beach for the day. As a younger married couple, we were a little bored here and didn't like the $20 cab ride to Lahaina for some nightlife. Whaler's Village (shops and restaurants) is about a mile away, but it is more family-oriented and wraps up relatively early.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: alremc
Reviews.Content: Home away from home, our first visit to Maui and the El Dorado made it a memorable one. The staff was absolutely wonderful and helpful from the moment we checked in to the time we checked out. They were always there to answer all questions and to provide transportation, to the cabana. Of the cabana, well equipped and it was like having your own private beachhouse. Though our room was not along the beach and the view was a partial view, after visiting the hotels and condos along the beach we were very thankful for the slow pace of the complex. We thoroughly enjoyed not having allot of people out and about. Pam, the facility tour concierge was just great to work with and laid out a very thought out plan for us to make our visit more enjoyable. Evening she recommended was spot on and not a disappointing minute. Thank you El Dorado for a unforgettable visit. Would absolutely no doubt stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Maui paradise revisited”
Reviews.Author: CromQueenstown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the Maui Eldorado after 13 years ,and without any children.We were relieved to see that everything we loved before had not changed..the individually decorated rooms,the uncrowded pool and the immaculate landscaping. The woman at the activity desk suggested we snorkel on a catamaran trip based in Ka anapali rather than Molokini and we had the most amazing time..we were glad of her recommendation.We saw so many dolphins and turtles and the boat crew were fantastic. With friends in other units the location is perfect for walking ,beach and easy walking distance to Whalers village. We are already planning to come back with the kids next time.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn D
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, staff, peacefulness, and proximity to beach for swimming and snorkling. It's fun to bring a laptop or Ipad down to the beach cabana and wave to the webcam which records you in realtime. Friends and family can see what they're missing!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: PaulNZ
Reviews.Content: This place is outstanding and hard to fault. It has all the bells and whistles, a short walk to the beach (note: anyone who needs to use those golf buggyâ€™s to travel the 300 metres clearly needs the exercise) The beach cabana is a great idea worthy of adopting more often. Itâ€™s also a walk of less than a kilometre to The Whalers Centre. Modern and spacious if your budget can afford it you canâ€™t go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Sad occasion but great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: PerkyPeg
Reviews.Content: In Maui after our son died in vehicle accident, chose this spot at the last minute. 2-bedroom condo gave all 5 adults lots of "breathing room." Convenient location and wonderful staff. Got home, realized we forgot stuff in the dresser, they mailed it to us the next day. Nice having the washer/dryer in unit and fully stocked kitchen (need the pizza cutter, right?) We thought this was a lot better than the big resorts as we got out and explored rather than sitting by a pool, have someone bring drinks/lunch then walking to the inhouse restaurant for dinner. Great price and exactly what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home With Extra Special Attention”
Reviews.Author: xangch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 days, J bldg. studio partial ocean view at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado Resort, We were on our HONEYMOON! We wished we could have stayed here instead of traveling to other island. Our money spent well. studio unit we were in was HUGE! SPACIOUS! It was a surprise for us and a treat. Unit is fully equipped. washer, dryer, stove, oven, and a full refrigerator. Unit was clean. Truly! It felt like home with extra special treatment. WE BOTH LOVE, LOVE the lady at the Front Desk (MaryAnn) cute sense of humor, she made our honeymoon vacation to remember forever! First thing we walked into the lobby she greeted us like we belong here. Everyone was great, but the first expression is much memorable. She hooked us up with local food and location. Sansei, Kobes, Maui Mixed Plate is where everyone should go. Excellent food! We think we have gained a little hahaha!, but our was spent well again! MAUI IS TRULY THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: robvia
Reviews.Content: As others have said, great location. Short walking distance to the Sheraton and Black Rock. Not that far of a walk to Whaler's Village either. We jogged next to the cart path for some exercise over to the village. Parking garage is in the middle, we were in unit I-201, right next to the garage with a partial golf course view, yet it was booked as a 1 bedroom garden view. The unit is huge for what you pay, 2 beds (we only used one), and a big living room area, plus the patio. Only cons I have is there is no work out facility. If you want to work out, you'll have to pay to use a facility. We jogged along the golf course (as many others do), did some pushups, and swam laps in the pool located on top of the garage instead. We also stayed 2 nights at the Kapalua Villas as a splurge and liked Eldorado better. The Villas were fancy smancy, but for the money, we thought the extra space and fancy stuff wasn't necessary. The location of Eldorado makes it the winner. A clean (firm) bed and shower area is what you're looking for in these places. This one had some mildew on the shower head, so do the Villas, but I can over look that and did mention it to the staff and my followup survey. Both beds were clean and firm here. Black Rock is the best snorkel location, and this hotel is right there. Don't worry about the views. Garden view is fine, and your view will be of a golf course no matter what you pick, even if it's a garden view. Some units do see the ocean, but you're gong to see that in person any way. So if you're on a budget and don't care about the view, the garden view is going to work and you'll be surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Tewaiponamu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 days at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado in a Garden View Studio Unit [Room K111] in late September. We were both surprised with the size of the studio unit - large in comparison with NZ size studio units. The room was spacious and had a rather homely feel to it, with dining table for 4 inside and outside dining/lounge area, comfortable lounge suite and a large queen/king size bed. The room also included full kitchen facilities including washing machine and dryer - though the dryer wasn't working properly in our room, but the hotel has laundry facilities. The hotel is within walking distance to a few restaurants and 5-10mins drive to Lahaina Mall where there is a supermarket, which my husband and I made regular trips to for groceries during our stay. Location is fantastic and a good spot to explore West Maui and what it has to offer. The accommodation also has its own store where you can purchase goods. On our last day we used the hotel's large pool .... and we pretty much had it all to ourselves. There is also a complimentary trolley bus that picks you up from in front of the hotel and drops you off at several other hotels [including Whalers Village]. We used this facility when we went to the Lu'au at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Asma H
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Maui Outrigger El Dorado (E204) and it was MAGNIFICENT! The room was more like an apartment, with a dining area, living area, fully equipped and stocked kitchen, nice size bathroom with separate shower and toilet room, washer dryer room, and living room with another attached sitting area. The view was breath-taking of the garden, partial ocean, and mountain. When we first got to Maui, I was ready to hit the beach, do our planned activities, such as parasail, road to Hana, hiking, beaches, etc., etc., etc. BUT - when we got to our room, I honestly just wanted to stay there! It was so tranquil and peaceful! It was definitely the BEST place to come rest our bodies after our fun filled and action packed days. The bed was comfortable and the room was kept clean. It was definitely useful to have a washer dryer. We did use the cabana at the beach which has 3 separate but open "rooms" if you don't want to be in the sun. One is a reading room with a stocked libaray of books, the middle is a kitchen area with a fridge, (pack a picnic!) and the 3rd is a little room where you can borrow beach towels (very convenient). The beach around the cabana is PERFECT for swimming and lounging. There is also a restroom and outdoor showers. We had the front office staff take us there in a gold cart, was a short drive. We also walked to the beach - not far and a pleasant walk. Other than that, the grounds are very clean and well kept. Service is excellent. Pools were very warm and clean and fun! (3 total) Walking distance from Fairway shops, and few minute drive from Safeway grocery store. Minimum 5-10 minute drive from Front Street, which was awesome and we went there almsot every night. Also a short walk to Whaler's Village which has really nice free shows and great shops and restaurants. JUST A PERFECT PLACE TO STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler2217
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights in the Outrigger Eldorado. It was a great value - lots more space than a hotel room and a great location for family. The beach cabana is great, although it is a bit of a walk for someone with limited mobility. The pools on site were great. Quieter area than right on the ocean in the resort area, and just a short walk to Whalers village for food and shopping. Great hospitality at the front desk and activities desk, especially with rides to and from the cabana. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to Maui”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoJilly
Reviews.Content: When we got to the front desk they informed us they upgraded us to an ocean view room. Went in to take a look and the floor all around the bathroom area was flooded so Walter (bear) took us on a little tour of a few others until we found one we liked. We stayed in A108. Room was very comfortable for the two of us. Great having a washer and dryer. Everyone there was super nice to us. The grounds are very nice with lots of flowers and good photo ops. The 3 pools are small and simple compared to the larger resorts but nice just the same. I was the only one in the pool every time I went swimming. There is a little market in the lobby with a good variety of stuff. The location is good and close to a lot of things just make sure you know where you are walking before it gets dark. We were trying to get back from the Sheraton the first night and couldn't see a thing, we were wandering around the golf course not sure where to walk and the sprinklers were going off. Its funny now, but we were so tired and frustrated. They will drive you to the beach cabana and back. It has a fridge and towels and beach chairs. We had a great time and felt very comfortable at the Maui Eldorado. We stayed 8 nights and it was not enough time to see and do everything we wanted. Go for 2 weeks if you can. Would go back in a heartbeat. My favorite things in Hawaii was swimming with turtles at Napili Bay, hiking the bamboo forest on the road to Hana. We ate at Mamas fish house, was amazing. Very expensive so I bought a $100 gift card a couple months before we went to take the sting out of it. I packed a bunch of snacks and cereal and I was glad I did, the prices are a bit shocking at the market. Really great pizza at Kula lodge in the upcountry. ooohhh I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back and coming back ... bec its well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: MillieWT
Reviews.Content: This property sits right on Kaanapali golf course. Its a cluster of low rise ( two floors only ) of FULL condos - cant go wrong with that. It doesnt have the glitz of maui's resort but it also doesnt have the tall towers and the zillions of rooms to figure out. its nice and simple. Mornings walk along the path to the beach, or concierge will always golf cart you to the beach - this property has a cabana by the beach so you can bring food, drinks and even cook your meals by the beach instead of buying out all the time. The folks around here are so nice - they remember us since we have been coming to this property for the last years...the grounds are well maintained. It has three pools that you can relax, each property has a full lanai that you can have meals to catch sunrise or sunset without the crazy high restaurant prices! We love to run around and pluck the plumerias at night since it has such a fragrant smell to it. We have not been envious of the big hotels bec this is a vacation away from the maui hotel crowds!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: JohnandLisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in May 2011, in a studio, partial ocean view apartment. It was excellent, nice and spacious, with everthything we needed. Nice to sit on the spacious balcony and look out over the golf course to the ocean. It was a short walk to the beach, or you could take advantage of the golf cart shuttle. Lovely beach, less crowded this side and the beach cabana was handy too. Also a short walk to Whaler's Village. We would definitely recommend and would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “We keep falling more in love with Maui--even with the tsunami!”
Reviews.Author: MaryDee1
Reviews.Content: The Outrigger Maui Eldorado is a condo complex partly owned by the holding company, and partly owned by private individuals. We stayed in a studio, garden view room. It was all GREAT except for the bed, which was in serious need of replacement. Unfortunately, we learned that our room was privately owned, so all we could do was to "say so" in our room evaluation at the end of our stay. Nevertheless, the staff were fantastic, friendly, helpful--you name it--from the groundskeepers and maids to the desk staff. There is a handy little "store" which stocks a nice supply of wine and spirits, as well as some snacks and fresh tropical produce. Our room was spacious and had a well equipped kitchen, washer/dryer, huge bathroom, and more than ample living area with a flat screen TV. We also had WiFi. One of the pools was 10 feet from our lanai door, which was fine with us! We would stay here in a heartbeat--with the caveat that we would want to know how old the bed was in the room before booking, if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff , We will deff come back”
Reviews.Author: irisual43
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean the condo felt like home away from home. We are a famly of four with two teenagers and the extra spacious condo was a hit. The beach is walking distance yey they have a golf cart always available. The fron desk and lady at the concierge desk were so friendly same with the young woman at the cabana! AT night it was so quite and peaceful . I love the place , the parking is 7 dollars daily wish they will elimnate that , bt other than that best value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Great place, might not be worth the trouble”
Reviews.Author: Dmstoli
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was made several months early, but when we tried to check in we were informed that we would have 3 days in one room then have move to another for the final 4 days. The reason given was that the owner wanted it and they had priority. The whole reason to stay in a condo is to unpack and buy groceries. So on day 3 we had to pack up and check out in the morning and check back in, in the afternoon. We paid for the day but didn't even have access to a room for hours. To make things worse it took them about 45 minutes to check us in upon arrival because their computers didn't like the way they had to split the room and they were unable to override the system. Great place, might not be worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Ever!”
Reviews.Author: NelsonandJeannie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for half of our honeymoon because we wanted to see different parts of Maui. We loved it! Our unit was perfect, and reminded me of my old studio apartment in Southern California. It had a washer/dryer, a spacious bathroom with a large closet area, 2 TVs, a nice patio, a big living room/dining room and a nice kitchen. It was good to have the microwave and refrigerator because we didn't want to eat out for every meal. This hotel was awesome because it was very comfortable and reasonably priced. To get to the beach, all you had to do was ask for a ride from the front desk and a golf cart would pick you up, drive you past the golf course, and drop you off! They provided beach towels there. The whole situation was comfortable and cozy. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Always a GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Johnsb01
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there July 8th - July 18th 2011. We stayed here a few times before and will definatley come back. The staff is friendly, helpful and always smiling. The grounds are beautiful and well keep. The location is great for all the activities the island has to offer especially diving and snorkeling. I can't say enough on how wonderfuly Ruby treated us. The only suggestion I could make is a Jaccuzzi would be nice after a long day of diving. John Barkocy & Family Southern California

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the island!”
Reviews.Author: Hsmart
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui for a vow renewal of a family member. The rest of the family were at the Westin Villas, but that was a little expensive for out tastes. The Eldorado is close to the villas and reasonabley priced. The bed was nice and comfy, we had a full kitchen, dining table. The bathroom was nothing special, but it was clean. We had a great balcony with a veiw of the pool. This property is on a golf course so the water views are limited, but it is still beautiful. There are nice cabana's on the beach to use. Our only complaint is that the hours on the cabanas are only til 5:30. You can easily walk to the beach or whalers village, but if you don't feel like it, there are shuttles available to each. For the price, this was a great stay and everyone was very nice at the hotel. We would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. Awesome. Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: mcosta511
Reviews.Content: it gets a little more difficult, each time, we pack up to leave the beauty that is Maui. this is our 4th time on the island, and it definitely won't be our last. last year (january 2010) we stayed at the outrigger eldorado, and found it to be the perfect fit both location wise, and amenity wise for our travel needs. so, when the opportunity to stay there again this year (june 2011) arose, we took it. we stayed in e-208. it's a great room, conveniently located just above the honu pool. it's been nicely upgraded, and had all the comforts of home. having stopped in at safeway, the day we arrived, we stocked up on the basic essentials for breakfast and beach lunches. it was nice to get up in the morning, have breakfast on the lanai, and enjoy the company of island birds. we grilled a couple of nights, and others were spent at aloha mixed plate, and kimo's (VERY ONO!!!). we packed our lunch daily, and headed out to various spots. my husband is an avid diver, so each day, we picked a different shore or two. we'd head back, to still catch some sun down and wind down at the beach cabana. we didn't even think to visit down there our last trip, and we should have. the beach cabana is awesome! it has all the conveniences of the condo (towel service, appliances, dishes, etc.). the best part was, that if you didn't feel like making the trek up or down the trail, they had a cart service. SO GREAT!!! we couldn't have asked for better weather! this was our first trip during june. we usually make it out during december/january. we were a little sad we missed out on the whales, but the abundance of honu made up for it. the amount of tourists was perfect. it was nice to see, and know there were people there, but it was even better to know that beaches weren't packed, and you could enjoy your own little piece of paradise. of all the times we've visited our little island in the sun, this one was by far one of my favorite. we travel to different places, in between, but the island has a sort of magic and beauty unparalleled that keeps pulling us back time and time again. who knows, maybe one day, i'll stay for good. MAUI NO KA OI!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: Onlinegeezer
Reviews.Content: Maui is so beautiful and this hotel is equally fantastic. Lovely quite room, and not far from the beach. All the amenities we need. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No need to leave this place!”
Reviews.Author: bchlvr54
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet. We just returned from Maui Eldorado. We were there from June 26 to June 30 2011. My husband and I were traveling with our two daughters ages 10 and 12. We had a friend staying in Kihei who wanted us to come visit her (saying her beach was better), we didn't want to leave the Eldorado! The condo was huge - B205 - plenty of room to be together (or not!). The beach was perfect for our girls. Just enough waves to make it fun but not too much to make me nervous. The cabana is PERFECT. We were able to bring our lunch and snacks down and not have to worry about keeping it cold and fresh. There is shade if you want it and lounge chairs to lay in to catch some sun. The snorkling was the BEST. We saw turtles, sting rays and plenty of fish! There were dolphins playing off the beach that you could see jumping. I would recommend this to families and if I ever come back for a girls week in Maui I would stay here again. Just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and "hidden location"”
Reviews.Author: Tripopus
Reviews.Content: Great 2 bedroom condo for the family at reasonable cost. Although right in the middle of everything, the beach at the cabana was always empty! Easy access to Black Rock without the crowds- we just swam around the corner! Golf course didn't seem like a barrier at all as staff always willing and able to give rides in golf cart to family. Quiet at night-no crowd/dormitory type noise. Will stay there again when return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger Maui Eldorado is a terrific place for Familys”
Reviews.Author: janiebutler
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great experience at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado. We had two accomodations, each was an ocean view, two bedroom, two bath unite. A full kitchen was just what we needed with two children. Lots of snacks and breakfast were served, even a few dinners. The master bath had a large dressing area my unite was on the ground floor with a beautiful view of the golf course and the ocean. Stunning sunsets each eveninng from our Lanai were a special treat. The property is set back from the beach so it isn't beach front but getting the short distance to the Beach and Cabana (just for the condo guest) was not a problem, just a short walk. But the staff will run you down and back in the golf cart. My kind of trasportation! It was our familys first vacation in a condo and having all the extra space (vs. a hotel room) was enjoyed by everone. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger is ruining the Maui El Dorado (a true gem)”
Reviews.Author: JsieckSantaClara
Reviews.Content: The Management company Outrigger is slowly destroying the Maui El Dorado which I consider a true gem on Maui. From the front desk staff manager and her female assistant Michelle to the RUDE girl at the cabana the service is absolutely horrible. This is very special place to my whole family and I and it is so disappointing to see what The Outrigger has done. Their employees are bothered by guests and truely do not want to do anything to help out either in regards to the condo (especially if you havent rented directly through them) or at the cabana. I will say the one kind person working there is the older woman working at the cabana on the weekends...other than that it is very disappointing. The girl at the cabana sits with a miserable face all day texting on her cell phone.....if asked she will throw a towel your way but you can tell it is NOT what she wants to be doing. If we didnt rent through an owner directly I can say without a doubt we would NEVER go back! I hope that either the Outrigger gets it together and re-vamps it's staff or this place is not going to make it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spacious Condo!”
Reviews.Author: lwelsby
Reviews.Content: We stayed in B206 from June 7th - 10th. I was very pleased! The rooms were huge! The condo appears to be newly renovated. The kitchen was beautiful. The master bathroom was huge with double sinks and had a large jetted tub! We had a very comfortable king bed in the master when I had only expected a queen. The lanai wrapped most of the way around the corner of the building and had a dining table on it and some lounge chairs! We payed for a garden view and could still see the ocean from a couple of places on the lanai! The beach was nice and not terribly crowded. The cabana was also very large, complete with a towel guy, bathrooms, a full kitchen, and areas to sit inside if we had wanted to. Our interactions with the front desk staff were also very gracious and helpful. Our plane left late at night and we were allowed a 3:00 check out which was very helpful! I read lots of reviews and was concerned about the state of the condos but we couldn't be more pleased! Our room appeared to be very clean and nicely painted. The internet connection worked great! The only things I would say is it looks like there's a stain on the rug in the living room, and the master bedroom air conditioning had a little trouble keeping the room quite as cool as I wanted it. Also, the blinds in the master let in a little more early morning light than I would have liked but the room darkening curtains in the 2nd bedroom were wonderul! I think one of the things people whe review this place forget is that it is a condo, not a hotel. We have stayed in condos several places and things are never perfect with the accomodations. Individuals decorate them and each one is different. People talk about the lack of maid service but again, this is a condo. Most of the places we've stayed don't offer maid service during your stay at all, especially not included in the very reasonable price that this condo costs. Someone came in and made the bed daily, cleaned out the trash and brought us new coffee. This pleased my husband very much! They even left little condiments jars! There are plenty of regular sized hotel rooms in the area that cost quite a bit more than the Maui Eldorado but I would much rather have the spaciousness, privacy, multiple bathrooms and complete kitchen that this condo provided. This was by far the nicest condo we've stayed in anywhere!. I'd come back tomorrow if only I could...

Reviews.Title: “11 days in PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: JoAnnMetroDetroit
Reviews.Content: We loved it!! The studio was plenty big enough and it opened onto a patio which is adjacent to the pool. It was what we were looking for...quiet and no kids. The kitchen was fully equipped with ice maker, blender and full size dishwasher. Our unit did not have its own bbq but there are two at the main pool and another by the heated pool. We were on the other side of Black Rock were the tours drop you off to snorkel. We walked to the Royal Lahina Luau in one direction and the other had all the busy hotels and Whalers Village. Do as little or much as you want but not a place for kids as these are condos.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate”
Reviews.Author: claudinemwalker
Reviews.Content: It is unfortunate that I feel the need to write the following unfavorable review. We first stayed at the Maui Eldorado three years ago based on the recommendations of others and were very pleased at the end of our 10 day stay. We recently stayed in your facility from May 18-May 31, 2011 only to have the end result be disappointment. It started with the end of our first night wondering how our feet had gotten so dirtyâ€”only to discover that the carpet in the unit was completely filthy. As our stay continued we learned that vacuuming only takes place every other day which seems unsanitary when you are in an environment of sand and water on a daily basis. Also bathtubs and toilets apparently donâ€™t get cleaned on a regular basis either. The microwave turntable in our unit (k106) was broken so food did not cook right and the DVD player only worked when it wanted to. Finally about 3 days before we were ready to leave I decided to read some of the reviews on-line to see if it was just me or if things had gone downhill as bad as I felt they had. I read some of the GM's responses and was surprised to hear him say if only guests would have let the staff know they could have received better cleaning services or a different room. It seems to me there would be a standard set for the cleaning services that the property would want all of their guests to receive and a standard minimum condition for all the rooms. We also had a situation where we were told that our air conditioner would need to be serviced from 10-noon the next day and we needed to be out of our room, so we were. We returned to receive a message that the service people did not show up and we would need to be gone the next day from 10-noon, so we did. When we returned at 1:00 to have lunch in our room we were interrupted because the service people came at that time insteadï�Œ When we checked out I did speak with the staff about some of the concerns only to be told the cleaning services have changed and now only include changing the sheets once in a while and taking out the garbage and bringing in clean towels. This is not at all what your guests are aware of when they purchase your services. One last thing, we had a surprise concert sprang on us without any courtesy of notice. In one of the reviews in April when a guest complained the GM said he would talk with the manager so that it would not happen in the future. It must have slipped his mind. I think all guests are asking for is just a courtesy notice that it will be taking place. Itâ€™s very sad that next year we have to look for a new location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: KellerTX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here June 3-12 for our 25th anniversary. Everything was wonderful. We enjoyed the spacious condo, the well kept ground, the extremely helpful and gracious staff. It was a bit of a walk to the beach, but it was a minor incovenience to experience for such a good value. Good snorkeling at the Black Rock and the cabana and it's services were enjoyable. The Outrigger also had the lowest rates we could find for parking ($7 per night). It's location is close to Whaler's Village & Lahaina. Check out the store at the main office and use the pretty pools! We want to come back to the Outrigger!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: AQ737
Reviews.Content: Pleasant rooms. We had a spacious 2 bedroom/2 bath with a great view and conveniently located. Buildings and grounds were well kept. Long walk to the beach, but at least there is beach access.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelWahine
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado. The hotel front desk and guest service were very friendly, caring, accomodating and helpfu. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and a great place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: BernardJuan
Reviews.Content: This is a well-kept "older" condomium located on Kaanapali Beach area. Probably one of the best kept "secrets" in the Kaanapali area. It is a wonderful location (close to beach, highway, Lahaina, Kapalua, etc.). The rooms are clean, comfortable, spacious and a great layout. There are ample walkways in-between the buildings, a nice swimming pool deck, barbecue area. I brought a fairly large group of people here (10 rooms+) and everyone had a wonderful experience. The 2-bedrooms, 1-bedrooms and studio units were just wonderful to spread out and stay at. Great value for the money in Kaanapali!

Reviews.Title: “I want everyone to stay here and enjoy it like we did”
Reviews.Author: Katherina59
Reviews.Content: I was responsible for picking the place that we were to be staying at and I felt like I did a darn good job. The rooms were clean. Daily maid service meant that the vacuum was used, the dishwasher got run, bathrooms cleaned, fresh towels brought in and the rooms got cleaned as soon as we left; be it morning or afternoon. Kitchens were fully equipped. Barbecues around the pool were gas and cleaned daily. We had private patios with chairs/tables/chaise lounges and ate breakfast outside. It was quiet at night, no loud noises, no partying crowds...but the best of all was the beach and the cabana! The beach was the best. Mostly sand but with1 area of lava rock (Black Rock - a well known snorkel spot) which made for great snorkeling--even saw a turtle. Little waves, easy to get in and out of the water. I don't like laying in the sand so the cabana was wonderful. Chaise lounges that we could move under the overhang so that we didn't have to be in the sun, full kitchen with all the blenders, appliances, dishes that you could possibly need. We lounged down there all day AND the beach was less crowded than if you stayed at the Whaler's Village hotels/resorts! We ranged in age from 19 to 71 and we all thought it was a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: lOUISE10815
Reviews.Content: I would not recomend this hotel. We had a problem with the laundry facilities in our studio apartment. Most of our clothes had what looked like rust spots all over. The management did give us about 1/3 compensation for these clothes by not charging us parking fees during our stay. We were still out quite a bit of money for the ruined clothing. We also found our unit to be well used and not very clean. There are so many other beautiful places to stay in Maui that I wouldn't waste my time or money staying at the Maui Eldorado again.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back!!!”
Reviews.Author: ABC123Teacher
Reviews.Content: My sister found this jewel several years ago, and we have continued the tradition of Spring Break in Maui at the Maui El Dorado for five years now with extended family. She has been coming back much longer. From the mature well manicured grounds, handy cabana on the beach, proximity to Whaler's Village with shopping, dining and shows, clean and comfortable condos with full kitchens and equipment, including blenders, washer and dryer, gas grills, three swimming pools, beautiful lanai to enjoy morning coffee and cocktails in the evening while enjoying the sunset, and helpful, amazing staff ( A BIG SHOUT OUT TO ROSS, at the front desk), you cannot find a better condo. The Maui Eldorado is an amazing value in an amazing location in Kaanapali. The property was built in 1960, but is well maintained inside and out. Each condo is individually owned and some have been updated more recently. We have always been pleased with the rooms from the Studios to the two bedrooms. All of the rooms have met our needs from Grandparents to little ones. A five minute, easy walk to the beach cabana, or a complimentary ride on the hotel golf cart, will take you to a wonderful beach to swim, snorkel or just hang out. Never crowded, lots of fish by the rocks. The cabana has restrooms, towels, chairs, and complete kitchen with ice machine. Chairs and tables inside and chaise lounges on the deck. Faith, the cabana attendant on the weekends is a sweetheart and a wealth of Maui knowledge. I look forward to seeing her each year as we are both teachers. We sing your praises, Maui Eldorado! Barb and Rich, California

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoy our stay because of the people at the Eldorado.”
Reviews.Author: Azores_2011
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a wonderful location. It was very clean and quiet. The beach is excellent and the pool is not crowded. It was the people that made the biggest different. A special thank you to Ross for all his help.

Reviews.Title: “What a great holiday spot!”
Reviews.Author: mango1421
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Maui a couple of days ago, back to cold snowy Canada. We have never been to Maui before. We booked our stay with Outrigger and will definately be back. The location is great, the staff is very friendly and helpful. Outrigger Maui Eldorado is the place to be for a very relaxed laid back kind of vacation. Very family friendly also. We loved the golf cart rides to the beach! We got a great whale show every day and swam with a couple of turtles! Thanks for helping make our holiday a great one! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Almost didn't want to leave the room while on vacation!”
Reviews.Author: tacoma96
Reviews.Content: This was one of our most enjoyable vacations ever, and a lot of it had to do with our accommodations at Maui Eldorado. This hotel is truly top notch from the rooms to the staff. The room was immaculate, the grounds are neatly manicured, and the pool is sparkling. It truly felt like home away from home. The beach cabana is also amazing. It's about a ten minute walk from the hotel. The rooms almost make you want to stay inside during the entire vacation!. There are 32 inch flat screen TV's in each room. They also have washer-dryer combinations, and a full kitchen w/dishwasher. I like the fact that they actually had hard-wired internet connections instead of wireless. Loading my hundreds of Facebook photos took minutes where as it would have taken hours with a wireless connection. They also have two huge gas grills at the pool area. There was covered parking for our vehicle as well as security on site all night. I have never stayed at a hotel that felt so much like home! Last, but not least, they have a small store/grill in the lobby of the hotel. The person that works there actually cooks, runs the store, and can also book you for whale watching tours and other attractions on the island. I will definitely stay here on my next visit to Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the feel of the Eldorado”
Reviews.Author: BCAI
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks with my wife and 2 teenage daughters. We all loved the relaxed atmosphere of the Eldorado. The Beach cabana was just such an awesome thing to have availible to us. We used it for storing cold drinks, prepping lunchs and get our towels. During our stay we saw turtles, whales and a Monk seal. All at the Eldora section of the beach. Amazing. We stayed in 2 rooms during our vacation as our first room had a clothes washing machine malfunction and a bathroom light that really liked to burn out. The second room was by far the nicer of the 2. Upgranded kitchen, bath and seriosly comfortable newer beds. The service provided by the front desk was prompt and friendly. An Aloha to Tamara for the great level of service she provided to us. This was our first time at the Eldorado but not our last.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: casSeattle
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at the Maui Eldorado and we loved it once again! We were in unit D103 which was right next to one of the pools. The unit was clean, very roomy and comfortable for our family of four, although it could use some updating. We love the beach cabana and having a full kitchen down there to have lunch! The Eldorado is walking distance to Whaler's Village which we went to several evenings for dinner. We were lucky to see an endangered Hawaiian Monk Seal taking a nap on our beach one day, and also saw it swimming in the ocean later in the week! There is excellent snorkeling close by at Black Rock and also north of the Eldorato on Kaanapali Beach. When we return to Maui in the future we will once again stay at the Eldorado.

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryStig
Reviews.Content: First trip to Maui and stayed at the Eldorado after a recommendation from a co-worker. Grounds were incredible. We stayed in D building and found it very close to one of the three pools and not a far walk from the beach. Unit 102 was modern and clean with a large king bed for my wife and I and a pullout sofa for our teenage daughters. Free wired internet. I think the entire grounds are supposed to be smoke free which is great and an important feature to us. We did the use the golf cart shuttle to the beach a few times as well. Snorkelling was great but on the second last day my wife was stung on three spots by a jellyfish. The last day we saw an actual jellyfish in the water. However all other days the beach and water were awesome. The cabana is great and we would take down snacks and beverages to the beach. Staff were helpful. Tamara at the front desk gave us a late check out as our flight did not depart until the evening. Thanks Tamara! we were able to enjoy more time at the beach. We will return to the Eldorado.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: mdsmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio K 111. It was well kept and very nice. The room was great. The beach area was beautiful The cabano area was a great amenity a full kitchen and to place to keep your beverages cold .The front desk staff were great. We were there for the Tsunami in March and the front staff was professional and helpful. We only stayed 2 nights and I wished it would have been longer. Next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rbattis
Reviews.Content: Short walk to Black Rock beach to snorkel or swim or the beach with the hotel's cabana. Free trolley to shopping a Whaler. Nice condos, good pools. Parking is $7.00 extra per day. We were told that condos had Internet but not wireless. I was able to pickup a free wireless network from my condo. With a car you can easily do many snorkel beaches and shop in Lahania. Would return to this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: sjloncari
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Eldorado for two weeks and it is like 'home away from home'. We love all the amenities, especially the washer and dryer. Having a full kitchen makes it easy to have some meals at home. Our unit in the K building had JUST been refurbished and everything was brand new. The view to the ocean was breathtaking and we saw whales every time we ventured onto the balcony. The staff -- both front desk and housekeeping -- are always very pleasant and accomodating. Needless to say, we will be back! Plus we tell everyone we know that is planning a trip to Maui about the Eldorado. You really get a "lot of bang for your buck!' Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd stay here”
Reviews.Author: VacaMaui
Reviews.Content: We've been to the El Dorado before and both times we thought it was what we expected. It's a good value accomodation. There were a few things in the unit that needed a bit of attention (cabinet door in kitchen wasn't working) but they sent around a maintenance man within a day to fix it. They definately need more BBQs though. We were in unit K111 and there is no easy way to get to the pool or BBQs (you have to walk through the parking lot or on the side of the building that has mud). Overall the place is clean and quiet, they have a shuttle to the beach if you don't feel like taking the 5 min. walk. Walking back from Whaler's Village at night can been tricky - there are no lights on the golf course pathway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility, well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: rockdocGunnison_Co
Reviews.Content: This was part of a package and we weren't quite sure what to expect and were very pleasantly surprised to find a very well run resort with upscale, fully equipped (even a washer and dryer) and nicely appointed rooms and very helpful and courteous staff. We love the lanai overlooking the pool and golf course. Wish we could have stayed longer! Our only complaint was that they do charge $7/night for parking which is a bit irritating and really "nickle and diming" people - especially since you have no choice but to park there.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYNorthcoasters
Reviews.Content: We have been coming back 4 out of the last 5 years and the only year we did not we took a cruise and missed Maui. From magical Ruby who gets us our unit every year, the maids, maintenance guys, gardeners, cabana crew, our friends from Seal Beach, and Pam who stocks our unit before we get there from the Eldorado Store. Thanks! A couple of musts! Happy hour and music at Hula's. Good reasonable take out from CJ's and China Bowel. Whale watching in season. Long walks on the Kaanapali Beach Walk. Golfing Kaanapali courses. Snorkling at Black Rock. This is our Maui and we thank all that make it special year after year. .

Reviews.Title: “Maui Eldorado”
Reviews.Author: KansasReviewer
Reviews.Content: The Maui Eldorado was less than expected. I had high hopes after reading reviews and seeing some photos. We were in B105 which is in need of a remodel. The unit is pretty much basic with sparsely operating amenities. Some lights were burned out, a ceiling fan did not work, some remotes had dead batteries, a dvd/vcr combo was not connected properly and the bedroom only had a vcr(who watches tapes). The shower area is seriously outdated and is in need of some remodeling. Housekeeping did a good job of keeping towels and bath supplies stocked, however, they came pretty early in the morning. The only thing going for the Maui Eldorado is the location and the beach, which is why we stayed there in the first place. The activity desk was not very helpful in trying to schedule island activities. We did not complain about the problems with our unit until check out, as I told the front desk that everything should have been addressed before we checked in and I did not want to deal with repair people while I was on vacation. That tells me about how the Maui Eldorado views there customers. The beach cabana is an excellent place to relax and enjoy. The beach area is awesome, lots of sand and no rocks. I like this area on Maui but will be looking for other possible accommodations. If you are looking for a fantastic beach without luxury accommodations then this is for you. If the condos were as nice as the area, the Maui Eldorado would be something.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place !”
Reviews.Author: hlwags
Reviews.Content: We were there for 2 weeks in late December. Having arrived late evening we were very happy to open the door out to the balcony the next morning and see the grounds ! It seemed every hedge, tree and shrub had a flower on it ! After being in the midwest and freezing the last 2 months how nice it was to smell the flowers again and hear the birds ! Our balcony overlooked one of three pools. The hotel was very quiet and we heard no loud partying the whole trip. It is a very short walk to the beach and the cabana or you can tan at the pools. The biggest pool was cold the first 2 days but heated after that. There is a banana tree and a papaya tree close to the pool and lobby. The maids were very friendly and nice. There is a golf course next to the hotel which in our opinion added to the beauty even though we are not golfers. The rooms are clean and were perfect for my wife and I. We can't wait to go again although it will probably be a long time before we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo, good view.”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Outrigger Eldorado over Christmas week. This was our first time in a condo and we really enjoyed it. We have stayed in hotels and all inclusives and we really prefer the condo. There is a kitchen so you can cook or just have drinks and eat out. There is a washer dryer so you don't have to haul all your dirty stuff home. We had a view of the ocean which was nice. The pools were well maintained and never crowded. The BBQs were available to use which was great - we BBQd Christmas dinner. This would be an excellent place to have different parts of the family meet up and vacation together.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: Northerner202
Reviews.Content: Sadly, we arrived home yesterday from a two week stay at the Maui Eldorado We visited in April and returned for Christmas with our adult children We stayed for 6 nights in an ocean view studio in the J building and 10 nights in a 2 bedroom in the D block Both units were fantastic The grounds are stunning, the staff from the grounds people to the front desk to the night security man who checked us in were fabulous We will return to this resort again and again. The beach cabana, with it's totally outfitted kitchen facilities, beach chairs and towels was such a blessing Missing Maui and the Eldorado so much already

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: aimeeallyson
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado. First, the positive. The location is fabulous! The resort is in close proximity to Lahaina Town and Whaler's Village, and is on a beautiful stretch of Kaanapalli Beach. Another plus is the Beach Cabana that has lounge chairs, towels, showers, bathrooms and a full kitchen for all your needs. The grounds of the resort are well kept and very beautiful. Front desk staff, concierge, and the staff in the lobby store were all very friendly and helpful. Now, the negative. Prior to choosing this resort, we did extensive research into the facility, including reading all Trip Advisor reviews. The one thing that other travelers kept repeating was to make sure to request a remodeled/updated room, as the condos are all privately owned. Despite making this request at the time of booking (three months in advance), sending an email to the facility a few weeks prior (I did not receive a response), and again requesting an updated/remodeled room at check-in, we were given an extremely outdated unit (J-102). I understand that Outrigger is just the management company for these condo units, however, I do believe a certain amount of quality control should be implemented. The furniture in our unit was chipped and peeling, the couch had a permanent dampness to it, the carpets were stained and dingy, the walls had scuffs and marks on them, the entertainment center was scuffed and marked, the beds were extremely hard and uncomfortable, the curtains were dirty and ripped, there was a hole in one of the bathroom doors, the bathroom mirrors were pitted and tarnished, the kitchen counters had dings and marks, and the main patio doors in the living room didn't quite shut all of the way. Having said all of that, the unit was extremely spacious and open with an amazing view of the golf course and the ocean beyond it. All the unit needs is a little money and some TLC. There is a lot to be said for pride of ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Corydon_62
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a lovely clean one bedroom condo with two large double beds, two bathrooms and kitchen/living room. Perfect for us. Cleaned each day. Short walk across golf course to wonderful sandy beach with sea turtles. Use of Cabana at the beach (house with beach chairs, towels, kitchen, bathrooms). Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: robSheffield
Reviews.Content: stayed for 8 night,lovely location,stayed in room 218,2 big double bed loads of room,cleaned daily, every thing about maui seems relaxed,chilled out,5minute walk to beach,not worth paying for a ocean view as golf course is there,it $7:00 a day to pay in their car park but at least it is safe,arrive from the u.k. 19 hour flight changing at los angeles

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location. Do not expect a mega resort though!”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui El Dorado for three nights of our nine night Hawaii trip. This condo complex was in a great location and an excellent value.
