The remainder of our stay was at the Grand Wailea so we were not looking for an ultra luxury location while on Kaanapali. This was our first time to stay at a condo complex and were happy with our decision. The location was easily found by our GPS located in the heart of the Kaanapali Resort area, right near the beach. (There is a section of the golf course between the hotel and beach / cabana) The condo is adjacent to Black Rock and the Sheraton. Self parking is $7, which some people were not happy with but I was pleased that the complex does not have a resort fee, which seems to run rampant in Hawaii. We arrived very late due to flight delays and were greeted by the night security guard Randy was very welcoming and took us to our condo and even assisted with our heavy luggage. (Dive gear). There is a central parking garage that always had plenty of space. The condo we were in for the first night was well appointed but unfortunately the curtains were sheer and did not block out any light. (they should consider making this a standard requirement of all the units) If we wanted to rise early every day it would not have been a problem, but since we were on vacation we wanted to be able to sleep in a bit. We went down to the front desk and she kindly gave us the option of a few more units to check out. We selected J120 which was a direct view of the ocean over the golf course. Very well appointed and comfortable. They even took care of transferring out luggage while we were out. Check in was quick and easy and our luggage arrived in our room promptly. The front desk person even gave us a bottle of wine for our inconvenience. I think that this was great customer service. The units are not ultra plush, maybe a bit dated but spotlessly clean. The complex has at least two pools, nothing spectacular, but nice enough for a quick lounge when you do not want to head to the beach. The beach and private cabana as well as Black Rock (great snorkeling) are about a 7 minute walk from the complex and is a really nice perk. I think that the beach is nicer than that of the Sheraton. The cabana has a nice deck with loungers, towels, seat backs for the beach. Though there are not umbrellas available at the beach, there are many nice trees along the dune line if you are looking for shade. The cabana also has a full stove, refrigerator, and sink area. This is a great touch that allows you to bring your drinks, snacks, lunch, whatever while hanging out at the beach. (The cabana was being remodeled and should be complete by now) Though this condo complex lacks the Disney-esque pools of some of the mega resort hotels, we would come back here in a heart beat. It was very centrally located in the Kaanapali area. You could walk to the shops at Whalers village in about a 12 minute casual stroll and easy to find. (Though if you come back at night it can be hard to find the walkways across the golf course......make sure to pay attention when heading out for the night.) The complex has a small lobby with an activity booking agent and a convenience store. There is a nice casual service restaurant in a shopping center right across the street. The rooms had nicely appointed full kitchens, acceptable bathrooms, washer, dryer, King or Queen bed, Couch, dining table, and balcony with chairs. It seems most of the units had 27" CRT TV's....I am sure owners will gradually upgrade the TV's. The units have free internet, though it is hard wired and not wifi. (If we were staying for a full week we might consider bringing a cheap wireless router) Housekeeping provided refresh service each day and was very prompt to come to our unit the day that we called for service when we had not yet seen them. All of the staff we ran across during out stay was friendly and willing to help when asked for assistance. We stayed at the Sheraton next door last year and for about twice the price I think we would just come back to the El Dorado....we would rather spend the money on activities and found that the location of the El Dorado is excellent. Though the grounds at the Sheraton were more stellar we felt that the rooms at the El Dorado were just as nicely appointed and it was nice to have the kitchen and laundry facilities. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: maddogmarty
Reviews.Content: The place is great!! Close to Maui's best snorkeling at Black Rock-(5 minute walk after cart drop-off). The cabana's awsome, too. They even upgraded to a larger bed for us. Look for the cute red-headed cardinals out on the lanai! Marty & Candy

Reviews.Title: “We booked unit A202 at the Eldorado...”
Reviews.Author: rahjaf
Reviews.Content: We booked unit A202 at the Eldorado directly with the owner through Maui condos by owner. The unit was perfect for us. Lots of space for the kids to run around, in suite laundry, fully equipped kitchen, games, DVDs, and a great view from the Lanai. The shuttle to the beach was excellent and the kids also loved swimming in the big pool. We are definitely going to return to this suite for our next visit to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: kk
Reviews.Content: Love, love the Maui El Dorado. This was a great place for a Mother Daughter vacation. The staff was so nice, they upgraded us to a one bedroom garden unit that was so nice and comfortable. Location wonderful, enjoyed the use of the beach cabana. My only negative is the $7.00 parking fee, really? All in all a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, relaxing, & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CatHannah
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the partial ocean view studio, with patio doors opening up to the golf course. We would definitly stay here again. It was only a short walk across the golf course to an almost private beach. The staff was friendly, and attentive, and the bed was cozy. You could walk to the shops at Whalers Village, or drive and get validation with a minimum purchase of $15, which was not hard to do. We felt at home, and would highly reccommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great family unit in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: frank_juszczyk
Reviews.Content: Very good location in Kaanapali although the development is set back from the beach. Although a lot of the units have no ocean view, our end-unit in Building A was right on the golf course and had an excellent ocean view (perhaps we paid a premium). The cabanna on the beach was reserved for Eldorado use only and we found it to be very useful and convenient, especially with the golf-cart type shuttle service provided between the units and the cabanna. The two bedroom and two bedroom unit was very spacious (approx 1800sf) and the beds comfortable. The main swimming pool is not very attractive but we did not mind too much as best use was made of the beach. Black Rock at the beach has great snorkelling but only when the water is reasonably calm. TIP: get a membership/discount card at Foodland in Lahaina (from the service desk in the store at no charge) and save an average of 20% on food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean, great beach cabana!”
Reviews.Author: ita360
Reviews.Content: Ok, most important thing first. Hopefully the hotel management reads this. The night security guard Randy is absolutely FANTASTIC! Because we arrived late he let us into our room. Very friendly and welcoming. After we settled in we went out to look at the stars (we are city people and don't see them that often) and Randy happened to be doing his rounds and drove by on his golf cart. We were chatting with him about the stars and the island when he told us that later that night (around 1am) there was supposed to be a meteor shower. He suggested we go out to the golf course for a better view. He then changed his mind, told us to hop on and drove us down to the beach cabana for an even better view. He showed us where to not walk so as not to trigger the sensor lights and ruin our view. So there we sat on our first night (or morning) laying on the beach chairs on the cabana watching shooting stars (about one a min or so) with the waves in the background as our soundtrack! AMAZING night we will never forget and all thanks to Randy!!! Also, as we are night owls we came across Randy throughout our stay and actually looking forward to seeing him. If we had our lanai door open and he was driving by he'd stop and say "hey night owls! have fun today?" and he would stop for a quick chat. Such a sweet man!!!! Ok onto the hotel. The bad: Pay parking (booooo). Also if you stay on the bottom floor and someone is in the room above you when they are just moving around it sounds like they are dropping bowling balls. Luckily the room above us was only occupied 2 nights. The good: CLEAN rooms. Good beds. The whole hotel and grounds are immaculate. The kitchen and bathrooms were nicer than ours at home (granite in the kitchen and bath). Full kitchen & washer dryer in the room (dishwasher too). Free internet in the room (not wifi). The beach cabana is great! Full kitchen so you can bring down lunch supplies and make it in the kitchen. Also good to store snacks and drinks. Overall a great hotel made memorable by Randy

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: JASinAB
Reviews.Content: Booked based on family recommendation. Worth every penny. We booked the partial ocean view and got exactly that. The ocean was partially visable from our huge lanai. We were located right on the 6th hole of the Royal Kanapalli Golf Resort, but far enough back that errant shots didn't find their way to us. Our condo was renovated within the last 5 years, new fridge and stove, granite counters, showers etc. Very spacious 2 bedrooms with 2 queen beds in each. Great location, coffee shop just around the corner, Whalers Village a 5 minute walk down the hill or take the trolley that runs every Â½ hour. Onsite pools were clean and well kept but we didn't see the need when the ocean was right there. We also didn't utilize the ocean front cabana that is available for guests, but it seemed well kept as well. Housekeeping changed towels and tidied up daily, so it was a stress free holiday. This was our first visit to Maui and we can't wait to come back and share it with our kids, and we will request the same condo unit in the Eldorado. We could have paid more to stay "closer" to the ocean but why? The Eldorado was a perfect home base for our island adventures

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Northerner202
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Eldorado in April. We stayed in the K building, in an ocean view one bedroom suite. We were just blown away. Hours were spend lazing on the lanai, which had sweeping ocean views from across the golf course The unit was huge, spotless and very nicely furnished and outfitted. I have read negative reviews about aged units, but this was not the case with ours We are returning in December this year with our 3 adult children. Can't wait The beach is to die for, the grounds very beautiful Great place for low maintenance people who prefer to cook on their own lanai, and make their own cocktails to enjoy, as opposed to needing a full service resort with $10 poolside drinks

Reviews.Title: “Just one night....”
Reviews.Author: rtwtraveller10
Reviews.Content: I understand that most of the Hawaii condo are individually owned and chains like Outrigger are only running them. In the case of Maui Eldorado my feelings are very negative probably because I have been assigned a condo that was very unconfortable in very humid extreme corner of the building very "smelly" no view at all - it was very poor also as a garden view. I am not saying that the location and the resort are not nice I am confirming my negative feelings about my stay, most likely if I would have had a better condo my opinion would have been different. Poor clealiness - poor parking facility It was for one night only - transiting to a better resort

Reviews.Title: “Wake to the sound of swinging Golfers”
Reviews.Author: toddytom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property. To our surprise we were put in a newly renovated condo so everything was nice and new. This property is located ajacient to a Golf course and back from the beach a bit. However this was no problem as it took only about 3 - 5 mins to walk or you could get one of those carts thingies to drop you down there. The property also had a Cabana at the beach for guests use. We had our room serviced each day which was nice. Room was well appointed with full kitchen plus Laundry facilities. Great to keep costs down as eating out is expensive on Maui. We had a Garden View Condo which gave us views of the Golf course. Luckily no balls found there way in our direction!!! Must be better golfers on Maui ????? One disappointing feature was the indiffernce of some of the staff. We encountered this in Hawaii a lot. Of particular annoyance was the charging for parking. We have stayed in lots of Apartment / Condos and Parking has always been included in room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in paradise”
Reviews.Author: wholelottaworld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Maui 5 times and this is the first time that we have stayed at the Maui Eldoradoo, normally staying next door at the much more expensive Royal Lahaina. This Condo resort is absolutely fantastic. Set in lush tropical gardens and only a short walk to the beach with the best views in the whole world of Molokai and Lanai on the sea and the beautiful mountains facing inland. The Condo unit was fantastic with every amenity needed, crookery cooker, fullsize fridge washer drier, iron and ironboard. The room which was sold as a studio, was very large and airy and had a lovely patio area where you could sit on an evening. The location is superb, just a short stroll to the entertainment centre of whalers village, with loads of shops and a variety of restaurants. Would I recommend it............without a doubt! It was perfect in every way. There is even a private Cabana on the beach where you can store your drinks and food in huge fridges and there are cooker units to cook your meals. This place is truly paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Good value wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: beachgoers2
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Eldorado for the first time in 20 years last summer. Rarely do things stay the same but this place has. The staff were helpful and friendly, the accommodation is good value and the beach to our mind is one of the best in the world. This is the place to go to relax. The complex is quiet and low key. The pools may be basic but how often can you go to a place and get a whole pool to yourself. The units are spacious and airy, yes they do vary in quality so do your research. The only area of improvement could have been a really thorough cleaning of our unit half way through our stay. As we were there 17 days the bathroom mirrors and sinks could have done with a really thorough clean, same with the kitchen. Having said that I could have asked and I am confident it would have been done, the housekeeping did a great job of keeping us well supplied with towels and amenities. We recommend using the farmers markets for fresh produce and the 'Fish Market' north of the Eldorado in a strip mall just past 'Times" supermarket. Goofy Foot surf school in Lahainia did a great job getting this family surfing for the first time and we would do it again. The snorkeling at Black Rock closest to the cabana (not the Sheraton side) is good and not crowded, we often saw turtles. Gazebos near Napilli beach is great for breakfast but get there early or you will be waiting a long time. Special thanks to Ruby and MaryAnn who helped with our bookings and were always so kind and helpful. We will undoubtedly be back again. Williams family (Portland OR)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if no one else is there”
Reviews.Author: JollyNoggin
Reviews.Content: We loved the space of the one-bedroom condo. The beds were super comfortable and it was really nice to be able to cook meals instead of eat out all the time. TV was great. The sofa was a sleeper, so it wasn't great for laying on when closed. Almost two whole walls were windows which was great for enjoying the partial ocean view, but also let in car headlights from the parking garage way across the golf course for the Sheraton Maui. Parking is an extra $7 a night. There is a garage, but also smaller lots closer to some condo buildings. Our small lot was really tight to navigate. The kitchen was decently equipped but all the pan/pot handles got really hot (learned that the hard way). The shower was a two-person stall and was separated from the sink and vanity. The carpet was plush and the place was really clean. Propane grills let you enjoy the weather while you cook. A Fitness Center for guests to use is part of the strip mall at the Eldorado entrance. The complex does not have one on-site. We did not eat at the restaurant on-site. A short walk around the golf course (on-site) to Ka'anapali beach brought us to really soft sand and clear blue water. Black Rock is right there as well so snorkeling was fast to get to. A Cabana offers a mini-library, tables and a kitchnette for those wanting to camp out at the beach all day. The Eldorado offers a free golf-cart ride to and from the Cabana for those who don't want to make the 4 minute walk. An 8 minute walk gets you to Whaler's Village, an outdoor mall with restaurants. The whole complex got louder at night and busy with people once schoo/university let out. The atmosphere before that day was quiet, peaceful and almost deserted-mostly elderly couples. After that day, large groups of young people arrived and it got really noisy at night (parties on balconies, college students running around the golf course at night yelling). Almost two walls of windows means little sound proofing. We were glad to leave right after that change. If you're staying in Maui between June and September and prefer quiet (like me), I would not stay at the Eldorado. Lahaina is a nice town to stay in if you don't plan on going upcountry or south very often. Best shave ice (Ululani's), good restaurants, grocery stores, shopping malls and great bays for snorkeling are within 10-15 minutes (driving). If we return to Maui though, we'd stay more centrally located though, like Makena or Kihei, as the drive back to the middle of Maui from Lahaina became taxing. It's one lane, each way and this time of year, both road construction and a brushfire backed up traffic for miles.

Reviews.Title: “FAN-TAB-U-LOUS”
Reviews.Author: joyastt
Reviews.Content: The Outrigger was nice. We had no problems with checkin the staff was very courteou s and accomodating. They picked us up outsideour room and took us to the Cabana within 5 minutes of each time we called and they returned to bring us back at the specified time. This was our first trip to Hawaii and it was superb. Of all the places we've travelled this is the first where we are immediately ready to return as soon as possible if not sooner. The natural beauty was sometimes a tear jerker for me. The Road to Hana was so beautiful. Had I had a magic marker I would have written on every one of those DO NOT PASS signs, "AS IF I WOULD". It was a beautiful experience and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous,fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Judithbelznp
Reviews.Content: What can I say,Where do I start?We have just spent 11 days at Eldorado.What a great facility.It was the best choice for accomodation.It is lovely & clean & well laid out.Our studio unit was extremely well equipped & enabled us to do our own cooking most nights.All the staff from front office to ground staff & cleaners were very helpful & friendly.Eldorado is really handy to everthing.We chose not to get a rental car & found it very easy to get around.We walked to Whalers Village(10 Mins)& caught the free trolley back up the hill.All the buses on the island cost $1 a ride which enabled us to go to the supermarket & sight seeing.The cabana was brilliant.We would take our lunch there & use the facilities.Once again we would walk down ther & catch a ride back on the golf cart.I could go on but this is one holiday we will remember for a long time.Thank you all!! Hope to come back one day!! Judith & Russell bell New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: lestrada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Maui Eldorado for our honeymoon/first visit to Hawaii and we absolutely loved it! It honestly turned out to be just what we were looking for. The staff was friendly when we arrived and told us exactly where to park so we would be near our unit. It was laid back and we enjoyed lounging in our 1 bedroom (G) unit after a day of activities and sightseeing. It was spacious and had all the amenities we needed. We decided to save some money by buying groceries, which worked out perfectly since the kitchen was perfect for storing and cooking our food (it definitely saved us quite a bit)! We only visited the pool once (the largest pool was right outside our unit) and enjoyed it very much. We made a few visits to Ka'annapali Beach, which was a 5-10 minute walk depending on how fast we walked and how many pictures we stopped to take. Overall, we were extremely happy with our stay and were sad to leave. We will definitely be back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Last 2 nights in Hawaii at the Maui Eldorado were great!”
Reviews.Author: Roamer41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a lower unit on the B group and found accomodations very fine. The staff was extremely helpful and allowed us to leave a couple of suitcases wih them while we were in Lanai at another resort. I thought that was a great signal that they were very accomodating. The staff recommended a couple of great local deli's and a great dinner spot called Leilanis on the Beach. The snorkeling at Black rock was great and going from the private beact to the Sheraton was a wonderful swim. Seeing 4 Sea Turtles was an unexpected treat. All in all it was very worth the money spent,

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay, large rooms, super clean, beautiful grounds.”
Reviews.Author: MelzerSeattle
Reviews.Content: Room: We were in a lower unit, 1 bed with kitchen. We loved it! Updated unit, right next to a small pool, nice large patio doors with seating outside. Cleanliness: Room very clean. The small pool outside our doors looked slightly murky for half the time we were there, but they did service it daily. We mentioned it to the staff. The other pools were clear. The housekeeper we had was really nice and left us alone as we requested. We just wanted fresh towels and were provided them when we asked, Service: This is hard. At the end of our stay we forgot some medication in a cup in a cabinet...we had already checked out. After practically begging the desk attendent to check for it she called the manager on duty who did go and get the cup and brought it out to us. That was very nice of him, and the contents were VERY important to my partner. When we signed in I wish that the staff would have given us a run-down on different transportation options and the schedule for those, where to go and such. We eventually figured it out since we saw the green trolley go by on several of our walks. If you stay here, get the schedule from the front desk and use this mode. It's free (just tip the driver) and it's really fun. If you miss the pickup time, you may find it better to begin the walk. I somehow misunderstood and thought the ElDorado provided transport to Whalers Village, but apparently they do not. They do however go to the beach below the golf course. My partner was able to get a ride from ElDorado to the Whalers on one occasion, but the next time we asked they dropped us off at the top of the hill which was just silly. If you do walk, it's not THAT bad. Just walk down the hill along the street. Our first attempt to walk was down along the golf course and we ended up walking through other hotels to eventually come out on Kaanapalli Beach. Nice walk, but long. Enjoy your stay here!! We did and now that we "know the ropes" we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Maryann Turned a Sow's Ear into a Silk Purse”
Reviews.Author: WishIwasinMaui000
Reviews.Content: My father and I finally arrived at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado after the 10 PM front desk closing at the end of an exhausting all day journey from Washington DC. We recently lost Mom, and Dad wanted to go back one more time to where he had such good memories. In a previous Trip Advisor review, I recalled there was a room behind the reception desk that Regina had been placed in. When we opened the door to the unit, I immediately knew it was the same tired room that was in great need of renovation. Not only was I frustrated at the resort for placing us there, I was also angry for using Expedia.com. Something I learned about Expedia and most likely all the other travel.com sites is that they often end up booking unsuspecting vacationers in the worst rooms at the facility. When hotels and resorts donâ€™t want to book them, they offer them to the travel.com sites. When Expedia originally booked us in a king room, I called the Eldorado to tell them I had requested a room with two beds. After connecting me with the person who â€œhandles discount bookingsâ€�, I knew this was not going to be easy. They said I would have to contact Expedia again to make the change. After talking to numerous customer reps., I demanded to speak with a supervisor. Very frustrating but they finally were able to switch us to a two bed unit, of course at an additional cost. The morning after we arrived, I went to the front desk and spoke with Maryann Valois. I explained that I had read about this room and told her how much I wanted everything to just go right for the three nights we were to be on Maui as this was Dadâ€™s last trip. She fully understood my frustration. She asked us to return at noon and that she would have our bags moved to another room. We arrived back to room103 in building F. What a wonderful surprise to find such a nice, spacious and colorfully renovated unit. Maryann had come through for us and many thanks to her for the extra effort to make our trip a memorable experience. To top it off, when we returned to the room for our last evening, Maryann had placed a large going away package on the kitchen counter for us. It really left a great lasting impression on both Dad and I. When I return with my family, weâ€™ll be asking for Maryann. Also, managing a high-rise condominium in the city, I frequently find myself describing to residents the terrific accommodations and how Maryann saved our trip. Already have people asking for my brochures. Side note: Next trip, we will stay on Maui the entire trip rather then stay some on Maui and some on Oahu. If youâ€™re older, Maui is much more of what youâ€™re looking for when you visit Hawaii. Now, if they would just play more Hawaiian music. I would also like to thank Trip Advisor and the throngs of visitors who take the time to review and make honest comments about their experiences. So much great information was available. Donâ€™t ever leave home without visiting the site.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for Maui”
Reviews.Author: one_lucky_guy-21
Reviews.Content: We are Wyndham owners and because we own in Hawaii, we are eligable to use our points with Outrigger. We have never stayed in any of the Outrigger "condo-hotels" but the overall experience was not bad. As timeshare owners, we are use to this type of accomodations. So let me give you my/our overall impression... Location is very good. You are not on the beach, but if you are fortunate enough to get a unit along the golf course, then I think you have a bonus view. Some of these also will have a partial ocean view. We stayed in the J building, unit 105. We had a great view of the golf course which both my wife and I enjoyed. Each morning we would cook our breakfast (kitchen description to follow), have some good hawaiian coffee, and watch the golfers. All we had to do to look for the ocean was take about 5 steps out of our unit and there was a partial view. The units here are individually owned. Outrigger is the property manager. So there is not a lot of uniformity between the units. Some are more updated than others. Our unit was a 1 bedroom unit but it had 2 double beds in it. There is also a pull out sleeper sofa, that we did not use. The kitchen was fairly well stocked. Pots, pans, toaster,a rice cooker (which we used almost every day), and of course a stove, cooktop, microwave, refrigerator, and dishwasher. There were plenty of glasses, plates.... Just like being home! The furnishings in our unit were adequate. The TV's were not large or very modern. There was a DVD unit if you wanted to watch movies. A decent cable TV selection but not the premium movie stations. The sofa in the living room was... OK... but not great. Since it was a sleeper sofa, I think it can't be real comfortable. The bathroom was pretty spacious. Your regular run of the mill shower/tub, and a toilet in one part of the bathroom and outside of that was a double sink. Plenty of closet space and one of the best perks... a small washer and dryer! They gave us 2 loads of laundry soap which we used. Knowing we had this let us pack very little (no checked baggage) and hence we didn't have to wait at baggage claim to start or finish our vacation! The staff was pretty good. We did have one problem with our TV's and it wasn't until the 2nd request that anything got done, but they did take care of it all in one day. The units also have cable internet access. There is a modem and ethernet cord for those who bring a computer. No WIFI in the units but there is WIFI in the lobby. The pools are a bit disappointing. There are 3 of them situated around the complex. No hot tubs!! That was extremely disappointing. There are also a few bar-b-que grills around the complex. Wish they had more and had them spread around. They do provide both bath and pool/beach towels in the room. But we like to go to Hawaii for the ocean! The bonus to this property is the beach cabana that is a short walk or golf cart ride away. The cabana has lounge chairs, tables and chair under a roof, and they will provide chair backs for the sand (along with towels). The cabana also has a refrigerator and a microwave so you can pack up lunch, pupu's (appetizers), or what ever you want. There were severeral of us who would put a 6 pack of beer to enjoy. Then you can get up, get something to eat or drink, and go back to swimming, sunning, or whatever you were doing. There is also an outdoor shower and bathrooms there. The one thing I wish they would add.... how about some boogie boards or toys for kids to use. We happened to be given a boogie board by people who were leaving and then we did the same when we left. I'm sure the Outrigger can stock their cabana with items left by visitors. Then they could make them available to those who want them. We were quite happy staying here. They do charge $7 a day to park. That is another charge that I don't understand. The garage is not monitered by an attendant, nor is there any gate. The hotel is situated so that not many outsiders would park here (except maybe during the golf tournaments). So why not eliminate that charge! We did like our unit and I would recommend trying to get a golf course facing unit. Building J and several others face the golf course... ask for one of those units if you can. Lastly... why is this hotel listed under Lahaina? The hotel is in Kaanapali. One of the greatest beaches in the world!! Lahaina is just a 5-10 minute drive away. You can walk to Whaler's Village from here or there are some shops along the highway just prior to turning into the El Dorado. Have a nice stay here. It is like being at home with all the ammenities, but look out the window and realize you are in Maui... one of the greatest islands in the world!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: jrj
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 2 weeks at the Eldorado. We were in a privately owned condo - beautifully appointed, clean, wonderful view, and great location. We even had use of the grill on our balcony, which allowed us to cook in several times and splurge on some nice dinners. The walk to the beach took less than 5 minutes. We found the staff at the Eldorado to be very friendly and accommodating. I do know that some of the units are in need of an upgrade. You can request a recently remodeled unit or even ask to move if you are not satisfied with the one you are assigned. I recommend this property for anyone who wants reasonable prices, great location, and space to move around in.

Reviews.Title: “Room to move - next time will stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: PtKemblagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from Mar 30 to Apr 4 - me, husband, and children 14 and 11. After a 10 hr flight from Sydney to Honolulu, then waiting around for our Maui connection, then picking up our rental car and driving about an hour (on the "wrong" side of the road!) we were greeted with a warm welcome at reception. The wonderful surprise was that we had been upgraded to a 2 bedroom condo (H100). When we walked in my breath was taken away. It looked out onto the golf course and down to the ocean. The apartment was SO spacious. The main bedroom consisted of 2 queen sized beds and off that was a huge bathroom with washer and dryer. The living room had a harge comfy sectional sofa and a new flat screen tv. The kids had their own room with 2 single beds and their own bathroom. The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you would be likely to need - and more. (Rolling pin, cup and spoon measures..!?) We ate breakfast in every morning and a couple of dinners as well. On Good Friday we had a wonderful pasta dinner with a bottle of California wine while watching the sunset from our lanai. The property has 3 pools, the only one we used was the main one on the roof of the parking garage. Nothing fancy there, and lots of concrete. But being so close to the beach and in particular Black Rock, we spent more time snorkelling. The kids saw 3 big sea turtles. Definitely rent a car as you will need one to get around Maui. The Whaler's Village is about a 10 minute walk, and Lahaina is about a 5-10 minute drive away where you'll find Safeway to stock up on basics. The property is very well maintained and clean, but most of all I found it spacious and quiet. If you are looking for a peaceful break then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “"Accomodating" Accomodations and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: familyap
Reviews.Content: We scheduled this week-long vacation in Maui to recover from family losses. My husband and I traveled with his mother who had just lost her husband to cancer. I called ahead to let the front desk manager know that we really really needed to have a good vacation and hoped that our room selection would be the best quality. We arrived late to find that the front desk manager had tried her best to find us a higher quality room and offered us a choice. I appreciated that she heard us and did her best to accomodate our request. The rooms are given A ratings or B ratings depending on how the owner had refurbished it. After considering both options, we chose a B rated 1 bedroom condo (E103) because it was SPACIOUS!!! It felt a little dingy and a bit outdated, but it provided the room and privacy that we needed. We're not luxury-type ppl anyway. The room was perfect for 3 ppl as there were dividers that we could draw between the 2 queen beds and another one between the bedroom and living room. Traveling with a mother-in-law is not easy, but this place made it bearable. CONS: no hot tub on premises PROS: golf cart that takes you to/fro room to Cabana on the beach, daily fresh towels, TIPS: You could probably walk to great snorkeling in front of the Westin hotel from the cabana. We drove to the beach, only to look down the way and realize, "hey! that's the Eldorado cabana!" It's also a nice walk to the Castaway restaurant where we enjoyed a nice oceanside breakfast (not as good as Gazebo, but no wait either).

Reviews.Title: “Good value, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: TravelBirder
Reviews.Content: Was pleased with our stay at the Eldorado. As has been pointed out before, there is variability among the units, so some may be better or worse than ours. We reserved a studio via Orbitz which was a good size, approx. 700 sf. Room was clean, furniture and appliances were in decent shape (not new, but not old either). Dishes and utensils were provided and were decent. As for the location, I find the "15 minute walk to the beach" claims to be a bit exaggerated. It's more like a 5-minute walk to the beach. It's not any different than walks to the beach from your room at one of the mega-resort type hotels (the ones with lots of buildings, long hallways, waits for elevators, and strategic paths meandering past shops and concessions). The golf course is between the rooms and the ocean, so the walk is not in a straight line, which may make it feel longer, but it is literally 5 minutes max. The beach was nice and pretty open. Great for sitting or laying out, though there is much better snorkeling next door at the Sheraton (which is signed as a public beach). Nobody said anything to us when we brought our Outrigger towels through the Sheraton grounds to the beach to snorkel. It's probably about a 10-minute walk from your Eldorado room to the Sheraton beach. What was annoying was that the Eldorado has a number of nickel-and-dime fees. Fees for making toll-free calls, fees for in-room coffee (first one per stay is free, additional is extra), charges for laundry detergent (again, first bottle per stay is free, additional is extra). There was even a charge to use the safe, and if you declined it, they asked you to sign a release form at checkin. This doesn't exactly give the visitor a warm-and-fuzzy on arrival. If it were up to me, I'd rather they comp the coffee and safe, and charge for detergent. That would bring them in line with normal hotel standards. The Internet was free, though, which was nice (and fast). It is with a cable, though, not wifi. There's a Safeway and Longs in town, just a few miles down the street to pick up anything you need, along with several dining options. Overall, we were pleased with the value for the money and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place for a bargain”
Reviews.Author: oregon444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado for 12 wonderful days. Last year we got a deal at the Sheraton, but there were no deals this year so we booked the Eldorado. We were familiar with the property because we jogged past it many times the previous year and always thought it appeared to be very attractive and well-maintained. The people at the desk, especially the concierge, were very courteous and always helpful. We were in room K211, which is listed as a partial ocean view, but this unit really has a full ocean view. We watched whales every morning and every evening on our huge lanai. Although our room had very dated decor, it was spacious and the washer/dryer came in very handy. Our room was very quiet. We slept great. The beach cabana with towel and beach chair service were very nice. They also have ice water. We snorkeled almost every day either on the Eldorado side or the Sheraton side of Black Rock, depending on which side had calmer clearer water. We swam with sea turtles more than once. We also took the Teralani whale watching tour, which leaves from Kaanapali beach. The Eldorado concierge booked it for us. Fabulous! I recommend happy hour at the Sheraton (3-4pm) Black Rock bar and also the torch lighting ceremony at the Sheraton at around 6:30pm which ends with the torch lighter swan diving off of Black Rock. Whalers Village has many nice shops and is an easy walk from the Eldorado. We only sat by the pool once. It is extremely warm and comfortable, but the surroundings are not that appealing (the big pool). The Sheraton has yoga and pilates at 8:30 am most mornings. $10 (must have cash-you are paying the instructor) and you do not have to be staying at the hotel. We did very little cooking in our nicely equipped kitchen. We ate many times at CJ's deli (mostly carry out-we either ate on our lanai or in our room-our room had a dvd player so we watched some of our own movies). We ate at the Hula Grill on my husband's birthday and they gave us free cak-the music, atmosphere and food are all good. The coffee shop at the Fairway Shops had good sandwiches. The only drawback with the Eldorado is the walk to the beach across the golf course, but that is a very minor drawback if you like to walk. We will most likely stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “great bargain for Maui”
Reviews.Author: pagirl11
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay cheaply in expensive Maui, are not overly particular and don't care that you have a 15 minute walk through the resort to the ocean, this may be the place for you. First, the hotel staff were very accommodating. They upgraded my room from a studio to a one bedroom and I rented it through an opaque site. We saw another couple come in who had been delayed in arriving by a late flight and the hotel staff did not charge them for their missed night of stay. Our room was definitely dated, especially the kitchen and a little worn around the edges. The rooms appear to be individually owner and I imagine the accommodations could vary largely. These rooms were however huge with all kinds of storage space. They had large patios over looking gardens or the golf course, both of which were lovely. The pool areas were nice and well kept. Their private cabana on the ocean was nicely equipped but seemed to fill up early with people saving chairs and tables, but not utilizing them. One complaint I would have is that the railing in the cabana is so high that you have trouble seeing the ocean when sun bathing. Overall, if I was doing Maui "on the Cheap" I would definitely consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good, the second time around”
Reviews.Author: coolcatCanada
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Maui Eldorado, and were put in unit L102. This unit left a little something to be desired, and didn't have a dining room table, which proved to be an issue with an 18 month old and Four year old. I let the front desk know right away we wanted to move and I was told I had to wait for 2 days until availability. I was a little ticked that I wasn't offered a free upgrade because after a long day of travel, I was quite disappointed in the accomodations. I did let the front desk know several times we wanted to move and felt I was being pushy about the subject. The day there was availability, I asked to see the new unit, which was B103. It was lovely and the staff was quite helpful moving our bags, food, etc to the new location. My question remains this... why is there not a standard of quality for each suite maintained through the Outrigger? We had a great time at this resort, the grounds are great, we were steps from a pool and a short walk to the beach. I would stay here again, but I upon arrival, would ask to see my suite before moving in.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully relaxing vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: mnmom48
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Outrigger Maui Eldorado. We were once again very pleased with our experience. The rooms are well kept, with daily cleaning. The grounds and pools are meticulously cleaned. The full kitchen is nicely equipped. My husband was happy to have free high speed internet. It is a quiet, relaxing atmosphere. We enjoy the location, with a close walk to the beach, as well as the short drive to Lahiana (where there is lots of shopping and restaurants.) The only minor complaint I might have is that the airconditioning system is really not very adequate...but oftentimes you can open your patio door and get a cool breeze and there is a ceiling fan in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: travelerRegina
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 4 night stay at the hotel, but left after the first night. We stayed in a 1 bedroom with 2 double beds that was located behind the reception. The room was in very poor shape, the kitchen and bathrooms were very old, the air conditioning did not work properly, the bathrooms were not very clean, the bathtub plugs were broken, the taps dripped all the time, and the beds were not comfortable. The people who were in the room before us also left early. We asked for a different room, but the only one offered had only 1 bed, but it did look in better shape. The largest pool is also not very nice, it is all surrounded by concrete and located on top of the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: sjloncari
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this property and we will definitely return. Our studio apartment had all the comforts of home, was beautifully decorated, and was in excellent condition. The grounds were well-kept and the beach was beautiful and just a short walk away. Located very close to fantastic restaurants and some of the most beautiful beached in Maui. Our maid was pleasant as were the front desk employees. We had to leave early due to a family emergency and they were were accommodating. We cannot wait to return for a vacation next year and will stay at this wonderful little piece of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: Smitty1942
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Maui Eldorado was excellent. Front staff was excellent, the digs were a good value and the location was wonderful. Well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastics”
Reviews.Author: nellybell57
Reviews.Content: We will certainly plan to stay at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado if we ever come to Maui again. We loved all of our accomodations. The people were so nice and helpful and the amenities were great. We will certainly recommend this resort to anyone visiting Maui. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: JenaR
Reviews.Content: This condo/hotel is awesome. It is located within walking distance to the #1 beach in Maui, and has it's very own beach cabana. Our room was also equipped with a washer/dryer, fridge, stove, and dishwasher. This was so nice to have if you wanted to save money on meals while you were down there. We couldn't have asked for a better place to spend our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmilyS4
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. they were friendly and the view was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mkane88
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the stay and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like home.”
Reviews.Author: palmer101
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in Ka'anapali area for business and picked the Outrigger because this chain had always provided excellent condo accomodations in the past and the Maui Eldorado was no exception. We had a 1 bedroom partial ocean view unit that had recently been upgraded, full tile floor, big furnished lanai and everything we needed to feel at home for a few days. The garage parking seemed safe and secure, but the one caution would be this property did not seem handicap friendly (access to most units involved steps or a steep walkway up or down). I had worried about traffic noise as the complex is just downhill from the highway but it was quiet, quiet, quiet! We used the pool deck grills 2 nights and had the whole area and it's ocean view to ourselves. It was an easy walk down to the beach or shopping and restaurants at Whaler's Village, and next door to Round Table Pizza and C'J's Deli for quick meals.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: exafrica
Reviews.Content: Our 1 bed, partial ocean view was very comfortable. We opted for self catering so we could plan our own time. If something was missing we probably didn't need it. Save money and get the cheaper garden view units - you're going to be out all day or down at the beach or beach cabana anyway, and ocean view is somewhat limited. That beach cabana is a WIN! - feels very upmarket to be at "your cabana" while the others sit on the sand! Much more relaxing beach compared to the Sheraton side of "black rock". Everything you need is close by but you MUST have a car. Eldorado grounds are well kept. A most enjoyable 1st trip to Hawaii - take lots of money!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Honeymoon Destination”
Reviews.Author: valdezka
Reviews.Content: The Maui Eldorado was the perfect destination for us as young honeymooners. On a tight budget, but determined to enjoy Maui, we found this gem. The Eldorado is on the quiet side of Black Rock. It feels very private and the beach is great. Most of the restaurants and nightlife are on the other side of Black Rock in Whalers Village and in Old Lahaina, but it's easy enough to get to if you have a car. Our room was very nice, clean and certainly luxurious to us newlyweds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Eshkrsh
Reviews.Content: It was our wedding anniversary vacation and our first trip to Hawaii. The room we got was perfect in every sense! It was spacious, tastefully decorated, romantic, very close to the beach, calm and relaxing (no ocean view for most of the rooms but that was not an issue for us). The interior looked and felt like that of a much more expensive hotel for the money we paid for. The kitchen was well equipped and helped us save some time and money. Although, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, when we did, we felt very relaxed, and comfortable. Since the rooms are owned by individual owners and the one we got was recently renovated, there is no guarantee that the rest of the rooms are equally good. However, of the rooms that we accidentally got a peek at from the approach way to the beach, we did find most of them to be similarly equipped. The hotel is conveniently accessible (although a bit far from the airport) and close to the beach. The room service was excellent and the hotel staff were very courteous and helpful. Being located in the Kanaapali resort area, it is only a 10 min walk to the shopping mall and the Kanaapali beach access (with excellent views of the sunset). The only downside being, it takes a bit of a drive to reach to most of the other attractions on the island. But that was no issue for me as I totally enjoyed the curvey, beach side drive every time I took the route. Just make sure you don't get caught in the rush hr traffic in Lahaina in the morning and evening hrs. We finished our vacation with some great memories and would definitely stay again in this hotel if we happen to be here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beach and great option if your are looking for condo like prop.”
Reviews.Author: ibgenie
Reviews.Content: Reading other reviews I noticed that there were complaints about the staff at the El Dorado, and I can state that everything is the opposite. EVERY single person was a gem, the ladies at the front desk (Mahalo!), the cool kid in the shop and his mom manning the "event" desk were awesome. Each condo is unique, ours was large and possibly the back drop of the Golden Girls episodes, but we didn't mind the 80's Hawaiian furniture. A friend of ours (we were all staying for a wedding) were upstairs in a VERY nice updated studio. The pool is average, nothing more than a Motel pool, but who needs the pool in Maui. Plus, you can walk over to the Westin and use theirs! Overall the place is easily accessible, removed from the hotel madness, enough privacy to do what you please and offers the amenities to save some money with the full kitchen. Most def a place I would stay at again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: wsbfamily
Reviews.Content: This resort is great, just make sure you get a suite that has been updated as there are many in this property that have never been (since opening in1969) We were first put in a room that was of the older variety inside but we asked to be moved because the bedroom was connected to the living room and our son would not be albe to sleep at night if he were basically in the same room as us. Our new suite had an accordian wall that pulled accross. Plus, it had recently been renovated. Our shower was not draining at one point and they were really prompt in fixing it. All staff has been so accomadating and friendly. This hotel is on Ka'anapali beach which is rated the best beach in Hawaii. It is also right on the golf course. It's just a gorgeous location. It's walking distance to Whalers village and a 5 minute drive to Lahaina. You cannot beat the location. It has 3 pools, one of which is really big. We have been really happy here, The Sheratin is right next to this hotel and rooms go for a minimum of $380 a night and we paid less than half of that here for the same beach location, plus we have a full condo with kitchen and everything and the Sheratin rates start at just a single room so I'd say it is a great value. Just make sure you are placed in one of the remodeled suites and you are good to go. I would recommend this hotel absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: crispyty
Reviews.Content: We booked the 2 king beds and 1 sofa bed (partial ocean view) at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado and stayed there for 6 nights. The unit we stayed at was J207, it was better than what we expected. The condo was clean and does not feel old at all. Although the room type was "partial ocean view", we actually got a GREAT view of the beach from the patio and sunset. We spent every evenings on the patio for the sunset. Maid service was available everyday, so clean towels and clean rooms throughout the trip. They also have several pools on site, but we spent most of our time at the beach, the only one pool we went to was pretty big located on the top level of the parking structure. It's only a 2-3 minute walk from the condo to the beach and the beach is very nice and clean. it's also a snorkeling place. One downside to this property is the front desk service. Staff there doesn't seem to know much. They couldn't provide the address to the restaurant we wanted to go to. We also asked them to check us in for the flight back home with 3 checked bags and turned out they ordered the wrong service. Instead of purchasing 3 checked bags, we paid for 3 priority access, which they don't even offer at the airport. We didn't find out until we arrived at the airport and the airline person told us we didn't pay for the 3 bags. But overall, it's a great place to stay. The location is great, very close to the Whaler's Village. It sits right next to a golf course and morning runs are awesome! I would highly recommend this condo and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value, Excellent Location for Family”
Reviews.Author: Eustacia
Reviews.Content: We rented a two bedroom and a one bedroom condo for our extended family--two grandparents, three single adults, young married couple, and 2 year old grandchild. Both condos were spacious and well-equipped. It was an easy walk to the beach cabana, snorkling at Black Rock, and Whaler's Village. If we didn't feel like walking, a quick call to the main office brought a golf cart right to our door or picked us up at the beach. Yes, the condos were not brand new or super luxurious but they were considerably less expensive than nearby hotel rooms, comfortably furnished, clean, with hotel amenities provided by Outrigger. Our condos felt like very pleasant homes away from home. The grounds at the Maui Eldorado are beautiful and the resort is very peaceful. Swimming pools are quiet and uncrowded, unlike the resorts directly on Kanapali beach, yet restaurants, shops, and bars are nearby for our young singles. We recommend CJ's Comfort Zone cafe across the street in the Fairway Shops for excellent everyday food at reasonable prices and David Paul's restaurant in Lahaina for a romantic dinner. We had outstanding service from the main office (especially Ruby Balagso, manager) who took care of the needs of our whole family from a 70 year old with a disability to the 2 year old child. We really appreciated the air-conditioning (in August) with separate controls in each room, daily maid service (not perfect, but responded to all requests), and outdoor patios. We would certainly recommend this hotel to other couples or families and would stay here again. Final note: If you like to snorkel, don't miss Honoloa Bay Marine Preserve, only about 15 minutes north.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: n2snoopy
Reviews.Content: we stayed in L100, 2 bedroom. It had lots of space, and was very clean. the kithcen was loaded with all essentials needed. the only down side there was a bar close for drinks at night and the cabana wasn't open later in the day to watch the sun set. All in all i would recommend Maui Eldorado to families. Cleaning daily, towels were there on request and front desk was always pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great view”
Reviews.Author: howaboutbob
Reviews.Content: J207, corner two bedroom condo. Huge view of ocean and golf course. Clean and comfortable. A few things showing wear, sliding door wouldn't lock, and master bath tub. Staff always working on grounds. Clean and well kept. Short walk to our favorite coffee shop, pizza place, and atv tour. Pools clean and uncrowded. Short walk to beach in not bad and good exercize. Covered parking in tight spaces. My new rental van got dented our first night of parking there. Quiet beach, fish out by rocks. Sheraton around the rocks. Major tourist busy with everything you ever, or never wanted. We like quiet, even with our teens. I would go back for two weeks in same unit!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet place, fantastic for Golfer, would loved to have an internal Bar”
Reviews.Author: uidb5370
Reviews.Content: Why an hotel when a condominium give you more space ? specialy that the Eldorado has a daily complementary room service. Do not have direct view to the Beach but quiet, and clean. 10 minute walking from the Wahlers villages for restorant and bars. Would have loved to have a Bar closer for romantic evening. The atttraction agency is expensive. you can find cheaper activity in Lanai. You need a car to go everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: JunxSydney
Reviews.Content: I didn't find anything special about this place. I have to admit the location was great but I didn't find their staff particulary helpful or nice. I didn't like the fact that we had to pay extra to use the security box, parking and fitness center everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: Icontrlu2
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several condo's over the years, some nicer, some with better beach access, but we've decided that the Maui Eldorado offers the best combination for the cost. We love the Cabana and not having to drag towels, chairs, etc. is great. Its a short walk to the Whaler's Village Complex and there's a free shuttle we used everyday to haul our "gifts" back to our unit. I had no problem with parking and asked for the local papers delivered each morning. No problem. House keeping did a fine job and very friendly. As for the BBQ's, our unit, J210 (studio) had its own and we used it every other night. Check in/out was quick and painless. There is a small convience store next to the lobby which we found priced a little more than the Safeway (5 minutes away) but great for the forgotten bottle of wine or sixpack or whatever. Our unit, J210 was great! Really nice walk-in shower with optional overhead shower head. Free wireless. comfy bed. A/C which we didn't need. All-in-all. Great time was had. Highly recommend the morning whale watch with the Gemini outfit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and some great upgraded rooms”
Reviews.Author: thetraveler219
Reviews.Content: The Maui Eldorado is in a GREAT Location and many of the units have been very nicely upgraded. The thing that bugged me was that the services promised such as great concierge service are practically non existent Front desk peoplr are very nice but the desk is severely understaffed. The grounds were once beautiful but now seem to be in need of expert care and god forbid you should try to barbacue by the large pool. The barbacues are so old nd under maintained that I would not cook food for my dog on any of them!.Not to mention that they are almost impossible to light. Too bad , because many of the owners have done a marvelous job at upgrading their units

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Condo”
Reviews.Author: littleones28
Reviews.Content: Great place for families because there's a kitchen, pools and close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good amenities & lots of things to do within walking distance”
Reviews.Author: jenlotus
Reviews.Content: It's a great place for an affordable place to stay with simple amenitites. We don't stay in the room too much anyways so it fit us perfectly! Plus: 1)kitchen and fridge - save money on drinks and early morning breakfast 2)roomy bathroom - after a day at the beach you have a good place to wash off 3)walk out decks/patio with view of ocean/golf course,-nice for a morning breakfast or late night star gazing 4)close proximity to public beaches- good access without paying for the price to stay at big resorts 5) washer/dryer- great! they even provide detergent 6) conceirge- expedia guy can book things w/ discounts and specials at the front desk Minus: 1) creepy crawlies: some seen on outdoor patio furniture... 2) not 5 star... but do you really need it if you are gonna explore Maui? This review is bias as we didn't stay elsewhere... but we still liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: SRS1017
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of other hotels that are the same price and definitely worth the money, unlike this one. The hotel staff were not what you would expect of a typical 3-4 star hotel. The front desk staff were particularly unhelpful. For example, our key was disabled twice in the three nights that we stayed, once at midnight, for no reason at all. We had to track down the only security guard to be let in our room because the rest of the staff was gone for the day. 1.5 hours later of tracking down the security guard and sitting outside our door, we finally got into our room. When we explained the situation the next day to the front desk, they were hardly concerned or apologetic. Then, the key stopped working again that same day only to get the same reaction from the front desk! This place is much more geared to owners of the property rather than hotel guests. There is no room service, late night staff, or easy parking. We had to park 5 minutes away when from our building late at night. On the upside, it is surrounded by a beautiful golf course and does have a wonderful beach cabana. But, once again, the cabana staff was rude, they ran out of towels, and did not treat the guests with respect. In case interior design is important to you, I would say the rooms are definitely dated. I HIGHLY recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Eldorado”
Reviews.Author: Hunwolf
Reviews.Content: We (family of 3) just finished a wonderful week stay at the Maui Eldorado. We rented an upstairs Garden view one bedroom through Pleasant Holidays, and were given 205B at check in. We were very happy with our condo as it had a nice view of the gardens, one of the smaller pools, and was in excellent condition (somewhat recently renovated). The condo also had a nice selection of kitchen utensils and even some beach chairs (which came in handy for our island exploring). One note about the Eldorado. They do have an Expedia agent on site. The nearby Royal Lahaina has a Pleasant Holidays desk as well. These come in handy for those that want to book something without getting hassled about a time share of some sort. Even though we booked our vacation through AAA (who used Pleasant Holidays) we did book one excursion through the local Expedia desk and they were more than helpful. Bill, the guy at the desk, dug around until he found a horseback outfit that would take someone as young as our daughter (see below). Some reviews mentioned the maid service was uneven, but we only experienced that one occasion. Otherwise, they were always done between 10 AM and Noon. We utilized the Eldorado beach cabana on a couple of days, but actually preferred the DT Fleming Beach Park up the road in Kapalua. There were less rocks in the water near the shore. I would suggest hitting the beach in the morning though. The wind kicks up some serious sand by afternoon across West Maui. Other suggestions/things we enjoyed: 1. The luau at the Hyatt (Drums of the Pacific). Very professional, but get in line by 415 PM to get a seat close to the stage. 2. Hula Grill (great place for food and sunset views) 3. Horseback Riding at Mendes Ranch. They are true professionals and took good care of us (even with our inexperienced 7 year old daughter) 4. We also did the dolphin excursion through the Pacific Whale Foundation. Great, affordable tour which allowed for great video. 5. The Ulelana show in Lahaina was also quite enjoyable. 6. If you are adventurous and patient, you can ignore the rental car warning and take the loop north of Kapalua all the way around West Maui. The views are unbelievable. 7. If you are into photography and flowers, the Kula Botanical Garden is worth a stop. Not so great: 1. We did save money by cooking in the condo, but you will be in for some serious "sticker shock" if you go to the Safeway in Lahaina or Star Market in Honokaiwa. If you have time, go to the Walmart or Costco near the Airport right after you arrive. 2. I was not impressed overall by the Maui Ocean Center (for the price). Not bad...just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat but close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: camperdiva
Reviews.Content: Peaceful setting, beautiful room with huge walk-in shower, and an easy walk to the main hub of West Maui (about 5 minutes to a multitude of restaurants and shops). We also loved the beach and the cabana, but there are no umbrellas for rent or for loan (pretty amazing for a beach resort). The cabana was nice and had a refrigerator for drinks and such, but it would have been nice to have a nearby beach-side bar. As it is, you have to walk over to the Whaler's Village side to access cool beach amenities. The snorkeling at Black rock, which begins at the El Dorado beach and wraps around to the other, more populated side was pretty nice (we saw a few turtles)--great to have such good snorkeling right at our beach. Upon arriving, the receptionist was going to give us a room right near the road (furthest from the beach), but I politely asked if there was anything closer to the beach, and she accommodated us. We had a garden view, which we enjoyed every morning while sitting with our coffee on the balcony (and despite the verbal and written reminders about it being a no-smoking facility, we had to endure the occasional smell of smoke wafting from a nearby balcony). Overall, if I were the kind of traveler to return to place I've visited once, then I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Our place to stay”
Reviews.Author: skidd26
Reviews.Content: This has become our place to stay on the beautiful island of Maui. We've stayed here twice in the last two years. Our last stay was in OCT of '07, I've just been too lazy to write reviews. We've stayed in a 1 bed + loft, and a HUGE 2 bedroom (1700 sq ft). I'll write this review with a summary of both stays and try not to differentiate between the two. First, if you're looking to come to the island and swim in a gigantic beautiful pool, and be waited on while sipping $8 drinks, stop reading now, and move on. The Outrigger Eldorado is about location and value for my family. This is the best of both worlds. Like every other review states, it is walking distance to Whalers village and all of what Kaanapali beach has to offer. It is located directly behind the Maui Sheraton and wonderful Black Rock (which has some GREAT snorkeling, and torch lighting at sunset courtesy of the Sheraton). Most condos have a good view of the golf course and some units have a view of the ocean (although I wouldn't expect it). CONDO: +Big spacious, CLEAN, well maintained condos +Housekeeping is very good at this Outrigger (we've stayed at others that weren't nearly as good) they are happy to leave extra laundry detergent, towels ect. Just leave a quick note and a small token of your appreciation. +Kitchens are FULLY stocked (cookware, etc) with everything you will need for cooking +Large Lanai's +BBQ's are clean, and in good working order +Cabana's on their quiet beach which have refigerators, tables, shade, lounge chairs, etc. +Towel/chair checkout service at the cabana -Parking, not the best, and an extra charge. -Pool areas are bland, especially the large pool (but really who cares, the beach is so close) -Not enough BBQ's Lahina is close, and offers a little more "affordable" shopping and dining along with a plethora of touristy stuff to do. If you want the resort experience and have the money for eating out every meal then stay at a resort. If you want to come to Maui and have a great vacation with the convinence of cooking some meals at home and stocking up your fridge with ice cold beer and not having to pay $6 a beer, then stay here. Happy vacationing!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Outrigger Maui Eldorado!”
Reviews.Author: MzGardena
Reviews.Content: The Outrigger Maui Eldorado truly met our expectations! Our unit had a fully-stocked kitchen, spacious bathroom area with a roomy closet and many clothes hangers, a washer and dryer unit, a lanai with tables and chairs to have a meal, meditate, soak in the sun or catch an evening breeze. We LOVED the view of the well-manicured grounds and golf course. The Front Desk and housekeeping staff were friendly, always available and ready to assist in a moment's notice. We had an awesome time walking or jogging the beautiful grounds almost every morning as the sun was rising and ending up at the Cabanas to take in the beauty of the ocean or other islands at a distance and watching the surfers and ocean swimmers. We also LOVED the fact that the Outrigger Maui Eldorado is centrally located in Kaanapali Beach and VERY conveniently located off of Highway 30 which is the main vein to other nearby towns and the airport. We cannot stop raving about Outrigger Maui Eldorado to our family, friends, co-workers and students! We will definitely choose to stay there again for our next Maui vacation as it was truly our home-away-from-home!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eldorado”
Reviews.Author: Traveler000000
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Eldorado from February 23,2008 till March 8,2008 in unit J102. The unit was very well located and maintained. Huge bedrooms well appointed. Beach Cabana a definite plus. Housekeeping was doing its job early every day. We have been pampered by Gheta who was like a mother to us. Staff was friendly and helpful.We will return asap.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: SilvertipOkotoks
Reviews.Content: This Condo Complex was built in 1969 - only some of the units have been updated. If you must stay here - insist on a renoed unit. Ours leaked water from the ceiling, the bath/shower wouldn't drain, carpet smelled moldy, couldn't talk when the dishwasher was on, balcony drapes kept falling off. K-111. Housekeeping dropped by every day - usually forgot to leave any coffee. You can't function here without a rental car and they charge $7 a day to park it - very little sense of customer service at this facility. The only thing the Eldorado has going for it that it's quiet - not much street noise. There are many alternatives in this price range and I would recommend taking just about anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: Tiny1ont
Reviews.Content: The condo is ideal for a family. We had a nice room overlooking the pool. Saucy and Wayne arranged several tours for us and we enjoyed each one. We saw dolphins, sea turtles, coral and fish when we went snorkeling(Gemini). The luau had lots of traditional island food and lots of it (Feast of Lele) as well as overlooking the water with a sunset. A helicopter tour was my husband's favourite-I was a little green (Sunshine ). We could walk to the beach and cabana-the best part was it was not overly crowded. Whaler's Village is within walking distance and can be reached on a trolley ride. We had an amazing lunch and dinner at Ma'alaea Grill (outside the aquarium). The condo was quiet and it was clean. Thanks, hope to be back. Brenda and Dave

Reviews.Title: “The resort is average if anything”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Outrigger Eldorado in 2005 as well and it was average then. I don't understand how these people rate their rooms. They rated K112 as 4 star -yeah right - I don't think so. Maybe 3 star but more likely 2.5 star. If you have kids, this is an ok place to stay. Everything worked and we used the kitchen to make a lot of meals but this place needs updating in a big, bad way. Oh and we asked for our room to have a door so that we could shut the door on the bedroom when the kids went to sleep. Not sure what was so hard about comprehending that but we didn't get a door to the bedroom so we listened to our twin 1 year old boys scream themselves to sleep. Good times. The pools are ok - not very busy. The beach is great when there's no torrential rain storms going on. Whaler's Village is close enough to walk to, which is nice and Lahaina is a quick drive. The location is great but many of the rooms need to be rennovated. My husband's parents stayed in K200 and although it is a large suite, it needs to be rennovated as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a great location. Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: RosevilleTraveler
Reviews.Content: We're just wrapping up an almost week-long stay here and have been extremely pleased with our choice. Our studio with garden view looks just like the pictures on the Outrigger site. Spacious. Not particularly modern or luxurious, but quite comfortable. Sufficient parking ... never had trouble getting a spot in the little lot near our room. The location is terrific. Walking distance to Whaler's Village, but not down in the noisier part of Kaanapali. Very quiet up here. We are in the far end (C building), but even then it's only a 5-10 minute walk to the Eldorado's beach cabana. Fantastic having access to that! Found out today you have to pay in other locations on the beach just to sit on a chair! Crazy. The cabana has lounge chairs, towels, bathroom, full kitchen. I would have given it five stars, but the housekeeping was a little odd. First day, it looked like someone got distracted mid-way, leaving a stack of five washclothes on the counter, not-needed second Kleenex box on the counter and additional toiletries thrown haphazardly into the basket, emptying of one trash bin but not others. Then one day, an overwhelming number of towels on the racks, the next day, spartan number. Yesterday, we were gone all day and came back at almost 4 to find it hadn't been cleaned yet. They showed at 4 and we just said to skip that day. That said, it was a pretty minor situation and didn't detract from us enjoying our stay. I'd highly recommend this place for the value. Great bargain in a pricey location. Also nice having the restaurants and gym across the street. Very convenient. CJ's Diner is great for any meal. Had breakfast and dinner there and both were very good. Great when you don't have reservations anywhere and just want a tasty, casual meal.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Value Lodging near Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: MartyGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a five night wonderful stay at the Maui Eldorado. The condo was large and very nicely appointed. The grounds were well maintained. The location was convenient yet away from the tourist hustle. At night, it was quiet and peaceful. I thought the condo was a good value. We paid approximately $100 per night less than if we were on a resort directly on the beach. However, be aware, it is a long walk to the beach. We were in Building C and it was a HIKE to the beach. There is a beach cabana with facilities and a refrigerator, so once you are down there, it is nice. The beach there is quiet and beautiful. The pool near our condo was smallâ€¦enough for an afternoon splash but thatâ€™s about it. The condo itself was nice. It was clean large and quiet. The resort is a true CONDO â€“ no restaurants or bars. Itâ€™s strictly BYO everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to enjoy Maui”
Reviews.Author: mauibillxyz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Maui El Dorado every year since 1989 - we spent 6 1/2 weeks there is 1998. Just got back in July from another trip there. It's NOT the Westin (Thankfully). So if you are expecting a resort with $20 glasses of wine - it's not your place. It's comfortable and quiet. Easy walk to the cabana and Whaler's Village and Kaanapali Beach. We've always had wonderful serivce and great rooms! I spent last weekend in Waikiki and it really made me miss the Maui El Dorado!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever!”
Reviews.Author: colleeno21
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely disgusting. We booked it for a week and ended up checking out the second day. The list of wrongs is a long one: the rooms had black mold growing in them (law suit waiting to happen), the units had terrible smells as well. The pool makes the YMCA look like the Four Seasons and not to mention there was a dead and decomposing rat on the pool deck. The staff had not cleaned the grounds in ages it seems and the person that helped us with our bags actually threw an empty bottle of shampoo onto the ground and drove away. Please, do not book your stay here, they cost us a whole day of our vacation because we called every hotel on the island practically to get another room. It is dreadful!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Money Saver”
Reviews.Author: Annoush
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Dorado (http://www.vrbo.com/75882) from May 28 to June 2, 2007 on our honeymoon. We wanted to stay on the Ka'anapali Beach and wanted to save money as well. I do not regret our stay at the El Dorado; it is very close to all the resorts on the Ka'anapali Beach. We actually loved the beach the El Dorado was on. On one occasion we saw tuna and turtles swimming there. They have a very nice cabana on the beach. This is not a place to stay if you want to be pampered or luxury. This is a very nice and quiet place to stay. This studio has all the amenities of home. I would recommend this place to a couple that wants to be on one of the most desired beaches and likes to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: EatLessMeat
Reviews.Content: After having read quite a few reviews about various hotels in Maui, we were skeptical about booking a condo. All of our fears were for naught. The El Dorado is an excellent resort. We walked into the studio condo (stayed in C101) and were wowed. The condo seemed newly renovated, very modern, and ultra-clean. The kitchen was better equipped than ours at home...everything from cork screws to dishwasher. This allowed us to cook most of our meals there & save a bundle of money. The bathroom was spacious, with a gigantic two person shower. Very clean. The room had a free cable modem connection, which is a huge plus.
