All condos have nice patios, where we were able to enjoyed breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The resort has three swimming pools, multiple gas BBQ grills, and a private beach cabana. This is another huge plus, given that the cabana is an open air building with full sized refrigerator, microwave, and stove. They also have showers and a clean bathroom. Covered tables & loan out beach towels and beach chairs are available. It's pretty much like having the condo on the beach. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay. The facility is private and very relaxing. As for location, you have a very pleasant 5 min walk to the beach. A Safeway supermarket & downtown Lahaina is 5 minutes by car. The location (Ka'anapali) is more remote than other places e.g. Kihei, but well worth it for the excellent hotel stay. Additional information: $7/day for parking (plenty of space available, so you don't have to hunt for a spot). Good housekeeping (brought new coffee every day). They have washer & dryer available for $1.25 each (they gave us free detergent at the front desk, which was quite nice of them). They have a little store to buy a variety of things e.g. everything from sun screen to breakfast cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: OrangeCountyJay
Reviews.Content: Outrigger Maui Eldorado My wife and I have visited Maui numerous times but the Maui Eldorado was the first place we stayed at. If you are looking for value and are planning to be outdoors a lot, definitely consider staying at this condo. Pros: If you plan to travel with a family and want to save money by making sandwiches or cooking a few meals during your stay (there is a Costco near the Airport), there is a kitchen and a fridge available. Reasonably priced rooms. Itâ€™s near Kaanapali and close to the golf courses. Cons: The walk to Kaanapali beach may be challenging for people who are a little older. Parking can get bad if you return late at night. Rooms were a little outdated. Places to Eat Around the Area: Aloha Mixed Plate - Cheap and good eats. Kimos - Make a reservation just before sunset and request second floor and enjoy the view while you sip a Lava Flow! Hula Grill - Over rated based on the reviews you see online. But the food is still good. Sansei - Great value for really good sushi! Activities: Road to Hana - Only got to the Black Sand Beach at Waianapanapa State Park. Whale Watching - Fun but if you do any snorkeling excursions, most of the outfitters slow down to view the whales, so donâ€™t need to do this. Old Lahaina Luau - Best on the island. The food is good traditional Hawaiian fare, take advantage of the all you can drink mixed drinks. Last Tip: Donâ€™t upgrade to an Ocean View a little too far to really enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “100% Aloha Accommodations! Booked with Pleasant Hawaiian”
Reviews.Author: xtinasanford
Reviews.Content: Back for our annual trip to Maui at the Maui Eldorado. This isn't the only place I have ever stayed in Maui, but it is on one of the finest properties in Maui. Totally private, quiet, lush, in between the 4th and 5th fairway...soooo unbelievably gorgeous. 'The same people have worked there since my husband and I and our best friends have been going for about 7 years now. They know us by name at the Cabana and in the lobby. We love relaxing at the cabana and sitting on the lanai watching the sunsets with a cocktail. Rooms are perfectly comfortable and many have been upgraded. All have AC and washer/dryer, full kitchen and patios. If you're feeling tired, you can even get a ride to the cabana or back to your condo on a golf cart. Boat rides pick up and drop off on the beach and snorkeling at Black Rock is fun. We wouldn't stay anywhere else on the island. See you in September! Christina & Mike Sanford.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know if I liked it”
Reviews.Author: coastalCoder
Reviews.Content: Worst stay at a hotel I've had. Or can I say that since I never got to stay there. When we tried to check in they told us that there were no more rooms avaliable, strange since we booked it 4 months in advance and no one ever mention anything to us. Instead they put us up at the Royal Kahana and told us that we would be upgraded to a one bedroom from a studio and that they would credit us one nights stay. Bate and switch. We accecpted but were not thrilled since we had booked the Eldorado so we could walk to the beach and restaurants in Kanapali. We also now had to keep are car rental the whole week and pay for parking in Kanapali. But to make matters worse, when we got to the other hotel the check in card said studio on it, not one bedroom. I asked the girl checking us in what type of room it was and she strait out lied to me saying it was a one bedroom, it was not. The final kicker, this was last year and to this day we have not been credited back any nights stay. We hated the Royal Kahana, checked out 2 nights early and stayed at a lovely B&B almost at the base of Haliakula. I will never again book through hotels.com or an Outrigger Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hugh rooms”
Reviews.Author: PAselma
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased when we finally got to the condo. Our flight to Maui was cancelled, so we were 2 days late getting there. But what a nice surprise when we did. We were in D104, 1 bedroom with 2 queen beds, 2 bathrooms, sofa sleeper, washer/dryer and fully stocked kitchen. Great view of the pool from our Lanai, but we could not see the ocean. Beautiful grounds. This condo is not ocean front. There is a nice walking path through the golf course down to the beach, but it was a pretty long way from our condo, especially with a large blister on my foot. However, there is a golf cart at the office that will take you over, if you want to wait for it. The cabana at the beach was very nice with kitchen, microwave and fridge. I found the staff very helpful. Our flight going back home didn't leave until 11pm, and they let us leave our luggage and golf clubs in the office rather than carry them around in our small car all day. Take advantage of the free Kaanapali shuttle that will pick you up near the office and takes you to the Whaler's Village. It does make stops at several of the more expensive hotels nearby, but we found it a fun ride. At Whaler's Village you can catch the Maui bus for $1 to Lahaina. Sure beats trying to find parking in Lahaina, which is very poor. Overall, we would stay here again. Very quiet. We didn't hear any traffic or other quests. Condo is not new, but very comfortable and clean. Great value for location on Kaanapali beach with the other much more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: kenkat1230
Reviews.Content: Room J 207/208. Spacious 2 bedroom unit on 2nd floor. Nice view, tastefully decorated, updated. very nice.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay-”
Reviews.Author: hcg33
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 days in Maui at the Outrigger El Dorado- 02/02/07-02/07/07. It was 3 adults- and we booked a 1 bedroom garden view condo- well, as I read on this site before we went, all the condos are individually owned, and therefore are all a little different. The first one they put us in was pretty bad, the decor was tired and dirty, but the biggest surpise was that while they called it a "1 bedroom condo" - it was really more of large room with a partial length wall between the beds and living room area, but no real separation or privacy of the sleeping and living/cooking area. I consider that a studio, and I did see several of these condos. Not what I had in mind at all when booking a "1 bedroom condo" for 1 couple and one single adult traveler!! After looking at 4 available rooms, we ended up in a great 1 bedroom partial ocean view condo in with a fully separate bedroom with 2 queen beds, a fold out couch in the living room, and 2 full bathrooms which was a real bonus. Kitchen was small but clean and up to date, and this room was just behind the lobby area so great for parking up front. We were in K204, great ocean view, nice big balcony- and we also saw and liked K104 which had the same layout. This hotel has a great beach which was never crowded, is a 5 min walk to the shops and restaurants in Whalers Village. Main pool was also quiet and had nice BBQ's there as well. If you are shopping for food, I thought the "STAR MARKET" just up the road towards Kapalua about 5 min was much better quality and stocked than the Safeway down the road to Lahaina. We got the best fresh local mahi mahi there and that on the BBQ as you watch the sunset from your balcony is pretty great! We ate out at SANSEI in Kapalua for sushi and it was quite good. This is a great condo style set up for familys or couples, and its so nice to be away from the crowds at all the hotels and condos along the beach by whalers village which gets pretty packed, and that is not my idea of relaxing! One last thing, if you are heading over soon, do find a whale watching trip, we did and it was a great experience! I will go back to this hotel for sure!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Los Gatos, CA - Northern California - Bay Area
Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Big, and Close to the Beach”
Reviews.Author: afgam
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Dec. 17, 2006. We stayed in room J204. Great location. It faces the golf course. It also faces the Sheraton Mau'i. The walk to the cabana is far, but you can call the front desk to take you to the cabana. The cabana is great, because there are towels and chairs available. So, you don't have to take your own stuff. There is also clean bathrooms. The personnel is good. The response is good. The beach is kind of rough for little kids. So, we went over to the beach in front of the Sheraton Mau'i. There's also a great place for coffee off of Keka'a drive. There's also a great place (deli) to get lunch and dinner. The best thing about the this facility/accommodation is the big condo. Not noisy at all except for the grass-cutters at 6 a.m. The kitchen is a full kitchen. The bathroom is small and the plumbing needs work. There also needs help with the cockroach problems. Scared the heck out of me. I sprayed 405 everywhere I saw it. The furniture is dated, but don't care when we were visiting "paradise". There was one thing that scared my husband and I the most: asking for a replacement key for our room. We asked for one at the front desk, and they just gave us one without confirming our identity. Scary. Maybe, we should have asked for a key for the bigger 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo. Those are end units and they are HUGE! One more thing. Shop at Costco on the other side of the island. You will go broke shopping at Safeway. Or another recommendation, ship yourself a box of dried goods. Also, the air-conditioner is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, quiet, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: DR_Traveler_Uro
Reviews.Content: My wife and our 9 month old baby stayed here. It was spacious (we had an upstairs loft and semi-separate 1 bedroom) suite. the views were fantastic (partial ocean view) and it was a nice quiet place. the decor wa somewhat dated, but relatively clean, although my wife wouldn't sit on the wicker furniture. There is great maid-service daily (so you don't have to make the bed!). the kitchen was adequately stocked with utensils etc. In-suite laundry is nice when traveling with a baby. Parking was not a problem. there is wireless internet, but only at the lobby and the swimming pool (this was actually good because you dont' spend time working while you're in the suite!). Overall, it was a good place with a relatively good deal (we paid ~$260/night). Nice short walk to the beach which was a beautiful and quiet slice of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Not the Most Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly8
Reviews.Content: This property isn't anything fancy but for the price we got a large clean suite. Our room contained a bedroom, bathroom, small laundry area, and kitchen area. We had a garden view and were within walking distance of one of the 3 on property pools. The hotel is in a great location. You are right near the black rock area to snorkle in and they have a nice beachhouse where you can get towels and chairs. You have a short walk across the golf course to get there but I saw them take some of the elderly guests over by golf cart. We walked one night to the Luau next door and had a really fun experience there. There is a trolley that runs into downtown Lahaina that picks up by the hotel but we traveled by rental car. There are a lot of snorkle trips that leave out of Lahaina and we took advantage of those. We also drove to see the volcano and Hana, neither are very close to the hotel but we didn't mind the drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALOHAX5
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 step-children (8, 10 ,12), and my husband's best-friend and his family (wife and 2 kids, ages 3 1/2 and 5/1/2 yrs) stayed at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado in Kaanapali Maui, 2 bdrm. I made the reservations and did A LOT of research, but I was still nervous. My husband's best friend stays at some of the nicest hotels but we (my husband and I) were travelling on a budget. We arrived at the hotel around midnight to find the front desk closed, but there was a phone for after hours check-in. I was getting really nervous. Someone showed up with in a few minutes and advised us where our building and room was (which happened to be D208, right across the way). He gave us a key card and we went to check it out.... WHAT A RELIEF ! I was very pleasantly surprised to find that it was clean and neat and VERY spacious. Because it was nighttime and I couldn't see the view, I was a little worried that I had paid for a partial ocean front view, but didn't get it. AGAIN, to my surprise we had a beautiful ocean view! We were on the second floor and had large lanais with chairs and tables. It was great. The larger bedroom was very big and the other bedroom was still a good size. I was very impressed with the location, size and cleanliness. We had maid service everyday. They were very friendly. The condos do not have their own jacuzzis, but they do have 3 pools, the 2 that I saw were nice, but we never actually used them... We were in a GREAT location with great beaches, so we never had the time! We never missed the lack of room service (which is usually overpriced). We had a good sized kitchen with plenty of utensils and cookware. It was perfect. I will say this though, our building was located the closest to Highway 30 off Kekaa Dr. and I am telling you, come 6am (Hawaii time) you could really HEAR the traffic from the smaller bedroom. Unfortunately the smaller bedroom has a small louvered window which allowed A LOT of noise in during the early morning hours. But we stuffed a couple of pillows up there and made do since everything else was so great... and since we are from California it felt more like 8am or 9am our time. We liked getting a jumpstart on the day anyway! It was also an extremely great location... 5 minute walk on the golf course to the best beaches ever!! Go to Black Rock by walking through the Sheraton. It is a lot of fun with great snorkeling! Some hints on restaurants... ALOHA mixed plate (lunch) on Front St. behind the Longs Drugs is amazing!!! Cheeseburgers in Paradise was a lot of fun, a great location and the Coconut Shrimp was great (better than the burgers!). Sansei Sushi restaurant in Kahana was REALLY good and a great price, especially if you order before 6pm (25% off!!!!) Hope this helps and ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “There have to be better condos out there...”
Reviews.Author: 1TheIceman1
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed with our five night stay at the Outrigger Maui El Dorado from October 30 â€“ November 3, 2006. We informed the hotel upon making our reservations that we were spending our honeymoon in Maui. Yet, the hotel placed us in Room E206. This studio condominium was located directly adjacent and below other condominiums that were being completely renovated. After returning to our room after a day at the beach, we were shocked to see construction workers in the adjacent condo tearing up tiles by hammering and removing a pillar to lanai with a jackhammer. When we entered our studio condo, we could see that we were breathing in dust from the drywall work and tile/concrete removal. Being placed in this condominium is unacceptable by any standards, and we were insulted that the hotel would do such a thing. We were moved to a quieter condo after complaining to the manager. This was pretty inconvenient in that we had to repack all of our belongings and uproot ourselves from our condo at a time that we should have been preparing to go out to dinner. This hotel was under widespread renovations throughout our stay and you could not escape the noise and sight of construction. This was not disclosed to us either prior to or after checking in., and the staff decided to let us find out on our own about the constant disturbances here. We would not recommend that anyone stay here based on the staff and the bad decisions they have made in the past. Parking is a little tight especially if you return to the hotel after 8-9 p.m. It costs $5 a day. The condos themselves can be a litle scuzzy, for example, mold on the shower curtains, grease stains on pots and pans. You definitely get the feeling that you are borrowing a friend's townhouse for the weekend when you stay here. It is comfortable, but the condos still have that lived in feeling. One bright spot about this hotel is that it is well priced for its location, directly across a small fairway from the Sheraton, right off of Kaanapali Pkwy. and a 7-10 minute walk to Whaler's Village. The walk up/down the hill to Kaanapali Pkwy. is infested with insects (i.e. giant red cockroaches) who are crossing the sidewalk to get to the golf course that is watered at night. If you don't like bugs, stay away from this hill and take your car down. Overall, you should try to stay at a hotel right on Kaanapali Parkway, You will have a shorter walk and will find nicer accomodations down there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Maui”
Reviews.Author: flygalaz
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-bedroom partial ocean view. The condo unit itself is quite large with a fantastic lanai and fully 100% equipped with everything you could need for your kitchen, laundry, large flat screen satellite tv, etc. The only thing missing in my unit was a high-speed internet connection so if you need one, request a unit that has it or use a wireless capable laptop in the lobby area (which could be a pain depending on the location of your condo). My condo was in the â€œAâ€� building and was slightly dated as far as dÃ©cor inside (lanai had great modern lounge chairs and dining table for 4). The couch and kitchen chairs were slightly worn and a little stained BUT the size of the place and how nice and quiet is it made me overlook that and they kept the place clean. The view is partial ocean as they say. I could not see it from within the condo but as soon as I stepped onto the Lanai (and I spent a lot of time on it because it was great), you do have a nice view. It is a little short walk (about 10 minutes) to the beach or main shopping/dining areas. The walk is also hilly so be prepared. For me (a fitness buff) I enjoyed the walk but if you have any issues with climbing a small hill, you should know this. They do charge you $5 a day to park but that is cheap compared to most the hotels in Lahaina. I liked the fact the area is quieter than the main hotel areas down the hill yet I had access to more action if I wanted it. You do likely need a car unless you want to stay in â€œhotel rowâ€� so I recommend getting one and exploring the island.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: luvkisses
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted with an apology and was given a bottle of pineapple wine and chocolates, didn't know why until we got to our studio condo which we realized was only a garden view and not a partial ocean view which we had paid for, to our surprised when we entered it was a BEAUTIFUL updated very modern with all the essentials that one may need. The decor, comfort and cleanliness was definitely up to my expectation and not to mention the wonderful rainfall shower which we LOVED!! It definitely made up for not having a partial ocean view, we did have a nice garden view. The grounds are very well manicured, it's very peaceful day and night. If you can request for J215 you won't regret it, it also has a nice large lanai and not to mention a great big comfy king size bed... the lighting is unbelievable.....there were so many different light adjustments to adjust the lights to your liking. It only made our stay more enjoyable. Definitely try out the horseback riding at IronRanch which is only a few miles away......the luau which is right next door at the Royal Lahaina is a must to do.......golfing at the Plantation was a fun and also beautiful sights to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: jennie_hp
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for a week. We booked a 1 bedroom partial ocean view. We were pleasantly surprised when we saw that our condo was a 2 bedrooms 2 baths when we checked in. Here are the good and bad about this property. Location. While it's not as nice as the other hotels/condos on the southern side of Black Rock (Sheraton side), it's close enough to walk to the beach and you save a bundle from not being right in front of the ocean. The beach in front of the condo is also not as nice as S of Black Rock. It seems the sand is not as clean, but it's good enough if you don't want to walk to the southside. If you snorkel, you can probably snorkel from one side to the other. I snorkel from the Sheraton side over to the El Dorado side and saw a couple of turtles closer to the El Dorado's side. There is also a free trolley that will take you to all the other hotels and Whaler Village on Kannapalli if you don't want to walk, but walking might be faster since the trolley has too many stops. Our condo is large. I think we have about 1600 sq ft of space. The views of the golf course and the ocean were nice. The furnishing is more than adequate but the sofa feels a little dirty/dated, it might be the color. The pillows are quite uncomfortable. The pillows are thick bouncy foam. My wife got a neck pain and had to use folded towels for pillow. We asked for smaller/softer pillows but they didn't have any. The pillows are definitely too big for children. The hot water in the shower is inadequate. We keep getting cold water during the shower in both bath rooms and had to switch back and forth between the shower head and the faucet. This is the biggest draw back since it was difficult to shower the children w/o a handheld shower, let alone a shower that keep turning cold. We washed our cloth everyday so we didn't have to bring alot and it's nice to come home w/o dirty laundry. The staff are alright. Some were outstanding, others just do their job. We didn't have any problem with the staff. The beach cabana doesn't provide any sand toys like someone mentioned elsewhere on this site. They only provide towels and chairs, but they have clean kitchen and restroom. Overall, I think we had a pleasant stay. I may comeback, but I will also look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “2 St. Louisians who loved the Eldorado”
Reviews.Author: StLouisErnie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on the Maui Eldorado from July 19-26, 2006 and we loved it. We have stayed at other hotels/condos on Maui, but the Eldorado was the best bargain compared to the others we have visited. We had a studio garden-view room (G104)and it was perfect for us. We made all of our breakfasts and most of our lunches in the kitchen, saving a lot of money to do other things on Maui. The washer/dryer in the room was a great addition as we did not have to pack as many clothes and we came home with a suitcase full of clean clothes! The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom area was huge and the Eldorado had plenty of storage space (big closet, dresser, etc.). The grounds were well groomed. The only "problem" with the surrounding area was the golf course that the resort is in was being redone and will not be finished until November, 2006. That was minor. It is just a short walk to the beach (5 minutes for us) - which had great sand, but it is a little steep in some areas. Overall, a good beach. The location is great for it is a short walk to Whaler's Village for shops and restaurants and a short drive to Lahaina and Front Street. Parking is $5 a day, but that is minimal. My wife and I highly recommend the Maui Eldorado.

Reviews.Title: “The Aloha Spirit is alive and well at the Eldorado!! AAAA+++”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveltheglobe
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two boys stayed at the Eldorado in June of 2006. We are airline employees and Outrigger/Ohana has an excellent cancellation policy - on our same visit to Hawaii we stayed at Outriggers on Oahu and the Big Island, as well. When we arrived for our five night stay at the Eldorado, the front dest gave us two Island Explorer Backpacks, for our boys, filled with lots of things to keep them occupied during our visit. Our condo was huge!! It had a huge bedroom, gigantic bathroom with separate toilet shower/ sink area. There was also a W/D and the resort provides you with as much Tide as you can use. The kitchen was nice also. The living room was very comfortable and the lanai was the entire length of the condo, with plumeria growing right outside our door. The resort is very quiet and peaceful and there are three pools to choose from. The walk to the beach is about ten minutes, but they will bring you to the private cabana on one of their golf carts. We spent one afternoon snorkeling black rock, in front of the Sheraton, but it felt a bit like "spring break" so we spent the rest of our time at the Eldorado beach. Whaler's village is a ten minute walk and is a nice outdoor shopping mall with restaurants, but we preferred the Lahaina Cannery because of the free parking. There are so many wonderful things to see and do in Maui. We left the resort one day and drove north. The road becomes very narrow and winding with lots of hairpin turns, but the views of the ocean below are a glimpse of heaven on earth! We will be back, and will definitely stay at the Eldorado againt to experience the Aloha spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Msshuffler
Reviews.Content: This condo property run by Outrigger is spacious and comfortable. Our one bedroom, two bath, room was great. It could have slept 6 because the oversized living room couches were actually twin size beds. The full kitchen was great, although Mom only used the microwave and toaster. When you under-pack because you will have a washer and dryer in your room, do not forget they are apartment sized appliances. The landscaping on this property is lush. Our kids really wanted to pick the green bananas from the trees that lined our front walk. The patio furniture on the lanai was great for lunch. The property is large, so, do not forget the staff will take you to the beach and cabana on one of their many golf carts. The concierge also offered useful advice about a controversial travel book I was carrying through the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: ra8s
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Outrigger Maui Eldorado 6/18-6/21. We try to always stay at Outrigger or Ohana resorts when we are in Hawaii because of their liberal policies towards airline employees. We arrived late night and had booked a partial ocean view one bedroom condo. The condo they put us in was not partial oceanview but it was a 2 bedroom and seemed to be larger then our own house back home. We found out the next day that that was the only condo available when we checked in and needed to move as the owners were coming to stay. The entire staff was very apologetic and accomodating. The next day when we returned to the condo we found a large gift basket waiting for us and a card from the manager. The hotel overall had beautiful grounds and we loved the tiled pool. The beach was a bit of a walk but not more then 10 minutes and was well worth it. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outrigger Maui Eldorado was superb”
Reviews.Author: Kona2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in F103 Unit of the Outrigger Maui Eldorao in the 2nd half of May. I was really nervous after reading all the reviews. But I'm happy to say that we LOVED Maui Outrigger Eldorado. The rooms were great! We had 1 BDRM Condo with Partial Ocean View. It had 2 Queens and a pullout queen sofa.FULLY FURNISHED! Including dishes, dishwasher, washer&dryer, Air Conditioning, Refrigerartor, Silverware, etc...Bar top stools, Glass dining table, 2 TVs, Phones, coffee table, nice patio doors and screened doors too on Both the rooms. Good private Lanai. Can't complain The staff was extremely friendly. The walk to the beach was great and on pavement, unliike how some said they had to walk through the dirt to get there, not true for us. There were paved sidewalks everywhere. The 5 minute walk to the beach is great and if you don't like that, the hotel provides CART SERVICE too FREE! I used it several times in the afternoon when it got hot. Also they ahve a nice FREE cabana for the resort users. Towels, lawn chairs, etc for use right on the beach. we booked our trip through www.outrigger.com There is nice shopping close by right to the south of the resort, you can walk to it. I rented snorkeling gear. The Cabana side of the beach in not crowded at all( What a Beach!). THe Sherton side is more crowded and great snorkeling. We also received towels daily! nice and clean. My trip was pleasant and we all loved it there. Will return for sure if I have our family going again. 3 swimming pools, cleaned EVERYDAY, I watched them clean. What a view from the pool, with the rainboow on top. Also, may I add, I think that our room was original. ie, it was great besides all the updates. I think carpet was the only updated part and it still looked awesome! Just can't complain. I hope I've addressed it all. Maui No Ko Oi ( No place like Maui). Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “The Eldorado is our favorite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the eldorado about 8 or 9 times and it is our favorite. We stayed at the Westin the last time we were in Maui and it was great for a hotel but it isn't as nice and laid back as the eldorado. The staff at the eldorado go above and beyond to make your stay perfect. From the desk staff to the maids and grounds keepers they are all wonderful and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The right place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came from the Palm Springs area and stayed at the Maui El Dorado, There is nothing bad to say about the Maui El Dorado, it had all the amenities you have at home. (I mean everything) and centered 5-10 minutes from everything, we were there for 11 days and didnt want to leave even tried to stay longer (nothing available) there is a 5 minute walk to the beach but worth it, very private compared to the other hotel we visited next door, it was perfect for beach snorkeling (lot of beautiful fish and turtles). the service was excellent and staff were polite and courteous, when you are in Maui be sure to take the helicopter tour (awesome) the Lahaina Luau, the submarine trip and also the dinner cruise we booked all our tours & activities through "ACTIVITY STOP" on front street, they were the most reasonable, we were surprised to find that nothing was expensive from the food to the shopping, I recommend staying there and would come back. There is so many good things to say and so many memories you will bring back, I look forward to going back next year (but I will pack less clothes). we took so many beautiful pictures (especially the sunset on our beach but cant figure how to put them on here. I RECOMMEND STAYING AT THE MAUI EL DORADO. Eric & Sheri Palm Springs California

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Maui El Dorado”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at this condo (5/1/06-5/7/06) this place was Awsome, the huge condo (J107) was bigger then my house, the kids really enjoyed the pool and the beach.... The staff was very friendly as well as the full time owners who live there.... Having a huge kitchen and washer and dryer was great.... I had read the bad reviews about this place before we left, but I don't know what the problems were this place was great... and I will come back and stay again..... If anyone has any questions please e-mail at julest2516@sbcglobal.net

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: LoisJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 15 day stay at the Maui Eldorado and it was beyond what we had hoped for. I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews but we were very pleased! We stayed in J206 which overlooked the golf course and ocean. Our unit was well appointed and immaculate. Everyone was friendly and very helpful, even at the front desk. The resort is in a perfect location on one of the best beaches in Ka'anapali. We truly enjoyed the beach cabana that provided towels, beach chairs, a full kitchen and restrooms. It was a short walk to Whalers Village which provided us with many memorable "Happy Hours". Lahaina is about a 5 minute drive. Make sure when you are in Lahaina that you make dinner reservations at David Paul's Lahaina Grill. It was truly our favorite restaurant on the Island of Maui. Pricey but well worth it! We ate there twice because the food was so wonderful. I am a travel agent and have traveled extensively. I can not say enough about our stay at this resort. I would go back there tomorrow if I could. If you do not like crowds then this resort is the place for you. We had heard horror stories about the prices on Maui so we brought wine and food with us that bogged down our suitcases. We did not shop at Costco but did shop at Wal Mart and Safeway. We found the prices to be somewhat comparable to what we are used to here on the Mainland. Some things are higher but make sure you get a Safeway card and it saves you a considerable amount. Please feel free to email me about any questions you might have about the Eldorado. The Road to Hana was beautiful. We went all the way around even though they tell you not to do so. I am extremely afraid of heights and although there are spots that make you think why did I agree to do this, I am so happy I did it as the back side was beautiful-breathtaking. I could go on and on but go to Maui and see for yourself. You will have the vacation of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable on Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in Kaanapali, this is not your hotel. Having made this reservation 6 months before check-in, my family arrived after a long trip from the mainland and were looking forward to Kaanapali beach before sundown. We were told that the hotel was over-booked and were sent off to another area 20 minutes away -- a tearful moment because the children's friends were staying within walking distance in Kaanapali and because the alternate hotel was of much lower quality with a small beach. They lured us in with the promise of beautiful Kaanapali beach and send us to one of their less desirable properties. The staff's responses indicated that this had happened before and that this was going to happen again.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Eldorado”
Reviews.Author: jkgetchell
Reviews.Content: We just spent 8 nights at the Eldorado in a private condo (not booked with the resort), so I can't speak about their value / service. The resort though is still a good place. The resort is showing its age, but you still have nice facilities, a short walk to the beach and/or Whalers Village. The grounds are well maintained and there's a choice of 3 different pools. Parking is adequate and you're a short drive to Lahaina or Kaanapali. This is our second stay there and we still love it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel operates a Bait and Swtich Scam”
Reviews.Author: baileyman
Reviews.Content: We had booked and paid for our March vacation at the Eldorado back in Sept,and phoned the Eldorado directly two weeks before our arrival to confirm our reservation for this hotel. Upon arriving to check in we were told that they were sold out and had no room at the Eldorado. If we booked and paid 6 months in advance how could they have no room for us? They tried to move us to a hotel that was quite a drive from the main Kaanapali strip. The manager was not helpful to us and suggested they had made a "mistake". Well while we were in their lobby for about 20 minutes they seem to have made that same "mistake" to quite a few people as they were turning others as we were in their lobby. I was furious that they would ruin our vacation this way, which was also our 25 year anniversary celebration. We had also stayed here on our honeymoon so this was to be a very special stay for us. We had to find another hotel on our own, with no assistance from the staff...we even had to ask to use their phone to call other hotels. In spite of it being spring break we were very lucky to get the last room at another hotel....otherwise our trip would have certainly been ruined....at great expense. I also found a post on the Tripadvisor forum that someone else had flagged this as a bait and switch operation some time ago.

Reviews.Title: “Can we stay?”
Reviews.Author: Chrysallys
Reviews.Content: I've read quite a few reviews about the property and was expecting something nice but not stellar. I chose this property for its price and location (moderate and upper Kaanapali). When we got here I was is complete shock at how nice it was. We booked through Hotels and received unit J211. What a beautiful room! These units are no regular hotel room but a full condo complete with kitchen (with any appliance or tool you'd need), nice bathroom with large sink and mirror area, a comfy king size bed, sitting area with TV & DVD, dinning area, and a washer and dryer. The condo was furnished beautifully and was very, very clean upon check in. The Maui Eldorado is near one of the best beaches in Maui which is only a very short 5 min walk away. The beach cabana is a great service with a full kitchen available for use, showers, and towels. Maui is my favorite island and I would love to stay in this unit again.

Reviews.Title: “You'll love it here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and when we arrived at Reception they told us they had nothing available, but the Staff at the Eldorado were so nice, they booked us into a very nice Hotel which is 5 minutes away for one night (free of charge) and they accomodated us the next Day, it was Expedia's fault not Eldorado. Anyway, we are absolutely delighted with the Eldorado, our unit has a Kitchen Living/Bedroom with a partial Ocean view. We have a Fridge/Freezer, Washer/Dryer...everything we need for a week's stay. We didn't want a Hotel because we are here partially for a Cycling Vacation, we rented Cannondale R5000 Road Bikes from West Maui Cycles, around 5 minutes away. So there's a tip for you Cyclists out there. There's underground Parking @ $5 per night, half what we paid at the first place, and the nicest part is we can leave the Top off our Jeep rental overnight without fear of waking up in the morning and finding it full of Water!! The Eldorado is conveniently located, turn right for Whaler's Village, left (on the 30) for a spectacular drive around the island...fantastic!! The WiFi (free of charge) is very strong where we are, right next to the Pool. Come to the Eldorado with confidence, you'll love it, plus, most restaurants are very spendy, so stop by at Costco, which is close to the Airport, and stock up for the week. There's BBQ's by the Pool!! We'll deffinately be back next year!! The Sunset's are fantastic, I've posted a couple of Pics for ya!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: fenger3000
Reviews.Content: After much hesitation we booked for the second time at Maui Eldorado in Feb 2006. Last stay was Feb 2004 in E105. That room was dark, dingy, damp and outdated. We booked for Feb 2006 through Great Hawaii Vacations after being assured this was a nice place to stay. When making the reservation, they added comments to my booking that we were returning guests requesting a 2nd floor "updated" studio room. When I arrived, we were upgraded for some reason to a a 2nd floor one-bedroom which was fantastic (Room B203). The room was huge with a large lanai overlooking the pool and golf course. It was updated, clean, bright, and contained two queen beds, a sofa bed, large bathroom with a very large shower, and a nice kitchen containing all the things we needed. We were very pleasantly surprised. After our own experience and reviewing comments on this site, it seems that Maui Eldorado has a mixed bag to offer. The parking is $5 per day and there was a small charge if you wanted to use the safe. There were still issues with having enough parking, but they assured us if we couldn't find a spot, we could just call security and they would help us. Although we only had a little interaction with the staff, they were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A major dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: bertaron
Reviews.Content: When you save the entire year to go to Hawaii you expect to get something out of it. We have stayed at Outrigger properties before on Kauai so we were extremely dissapointed when we went home. The decor was outdated in the room. The main pool above the parking garage was just a cement pond with water with absolutely no Hawaiian charms at all. In a previous post I agree with the person who said the bathrooms were dark and old. We stayed in G building. On the 3rd night there I heard rumbling in our kitchen. Somebody had eaten thru a plastic bag of food. Well when we mentioned that there was a 3rd party in our room and by the bite marks it was very large they said they couldn't move us for a day and not even a sense of "we are sorry." When they did get us a new room they wouldn't even help us move to K building which wasn't close. I even got some snide comments from the staff "Oh you are the one with the rodent" and then a chuckle. The manager admitted to me that they knew of a problem in Building G that is why they had an exterminator there the day I found our roommate. They offered to move us to building H but I refused considering it was fumigate the first 2 days of our stay. We have been to Hawaii 3 times in 6 years and this was the worst place we stayed at by far.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Maui Eldorado twice and had a great experience both times. Most suites are only a 5 minute (easy) walk to the beach and the pool area is huge and sunny. There are 2 additional pools that we never even used. The Beach Cabana is an added bonus and it's nice to be able to catch a ride with the golf cart shuttle if you are lugging lots of stuff with you. The best thing about the Eldorado is being so close to Whaler's Village without actually being right IN it. We would walk down early every morning when things were quiet and have coffee on the beach. It is much nicer to take quite morning walks in Kaanapali as opposed to Kihei (where I have stayed in the past). The resort is big and the staff are not overly helpful (especially if you rent privately and not through Outrigger). If you're looking for big comfortable suites, lots of amenities and a fabulous beach nearby...this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here over New Years and had a great time! The beach is beautiful as is the overall scenery. While I feel that this resort is meant more for a honeymooning couple, I am glad I had the pleasure of staying here. The room was huge and had EVERYTHING including a washer/dryer. I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants to enjoy a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for an economical vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week in a recently renovated studio unit. Good value for the money. My main complaint would be with the staff. They were not very pleasant at the front desk. The first night we were there, a huge cockroach came out in the kitchen. When we called the front desk just asking for bug spray, they told me the location of the nearest store and said that I might be seeing more so get used to the bugs. One of the pools was a pleasant temperature, while the other two weren't heated. Unfortunately there isn't a spa on site. When I booked the room there was no parking charges, but the by the time we arrived we were charged. When we mentioned the previous parking, they just shook their heads and said that we could park offsite someplace and walk a mile. Other than these mild inconveniences, the location is great. Enjoyed my stay for the great price that we got.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all my expectations”
Reviews.Author: mljohn
Reviews.Content: Booked as a package through American Airlines vacations. We stayed in J210 the first week in October. Huge 1 bedroom condo with full kitchen, living room/bedroom combo, and large bath. Beautifully decorated. Beach a short 5 minute walk. 10 minute walk to Whaler's village. 10 minute drive north of downtown Lahaina. Great value - much better than staying in a full service hotel. Would stay here again. Our daughter's room at the Sheraton was much smaller and more expensive. PS-great low prices on meals and drinks at Moose McGillycuddy's in Lahaina during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Val_FNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Would definately stay here again. We stayed in J205 - a 1 bd condo - heaps of space, nicely appointed. The beach cabana is great. The beach at this end is a little steep for me (am not a good swimmer though). One morning we walked along the beach to the Kaanapali Villas for breakfast - they have a restaurant right near the beach (we have stayed at the villas before so knew it was there). The beach here is much flatter for me also! Maui is a fabulous holiday destination - we love Whalers Village and Lahaina, the Cannery Mall is also good. Cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Got bumped to Outrigger Royal Kahana - Bait and Switch?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a maui vacation package through a travel agency and paid for it in full around three weeks before the trip. I arranged to stay in Maui Eldorado, after reading the favorable review here and in Frommer 2004. The night before arrival, I called Maui Eldorado for confirmation and was told that the reservation was found under my husband's name. When we tried to check in the next day, we were handed a letter signed by the manager and was told that they overbooked and as a result they are moving us to another Outrigger property called Royal Kahana, without presenting us any additional options. The letter presented the arrangement as "upgraded", even though according to trip advisor both average price and review of Royal Kahana is lower than those of Maui Eldorado. During the time we were in Maui, Kahana had frequent rain and drizzle while Kanaapali about ten minutes' drive away is clear, has dry road, not to mention has abundant options on activities and shopping. Subsequent discussion with Maui Eldorado did not lead to anywhere close to getting us out of the tired-looking high rise and into some place sunnier and more conveniently located like Maui Eldorado. This experience is extremely unpleasant. Please speak up if you have similar experience dealing with Maui Eldorado or with outrigger chain. As a vibrant online community we can help make sure that our vacations do not get ruined by unsavory business practices such as bait and switch, discrimination, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Maui Eldorado for a week in July while our daughter's team played in a soccer tournament over there. Our condo was beautiful with all the amenities of home. And the view from our balcony toward the ocean was pure paradise! We'll definitely stay here again, and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended! You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: TripMeisterFM
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for all but the pickiest of travelers. If you NEED to be right on the beach, or NEED to have a swimming pool with mulitple levels and swim-up bars, or if you NEED to have an on-site $20 per lunch restaurant - then this isn't for you. If you're looking for well-kept functional rooms with lots of space, one of the best beach locations on all of Maui, friendly staff everywhere, room extras just for the asking, a convenient location to everything on Maui, and quiet-respite accomodations - THEN THE ELDORADO IS FOR YOU! We stayed in unit D107 - a 1 bedroom that felt and worked much bigger. It came with 2 queen-sized beds in a suite bedroom complete with a full bathroom with dressing room and loads of storage (more room than we have at home!). In the "living room" were two single beds posing as modular couch units - just perfect for our two teens. Both of these spaces had walkout lanais with outdoor furniture and sunshades. There was even a TV in both room areas to boot. The kitchen was nicely supplied with lots of dishes, pots & pans, microwave, coffeemaker, drink mixer, toaster, blender, ect... Everything you want for 'making your own eats' for sure. The ice maker in the freezer was great and the fridge was relatively new and worked great. The dishwasher worked great too for easy cleanup of any dirty dishes. We even enjoyed watching and 'chasing' the couple gekkos that we found checking us out from the ceiling- they're harmless and just another feature of Hawaii! No problems with cleanliness or lack of towels or such...the housekeeping was great and can be 'scheduled' just for asking. We would stop at the front lobby on our way for the day and let 'em know when we expected to be back and the room was always 'prepped' for us on our return. Super Service! We bought groceries at the Safeway in Lahaina (a 4 minute drive) - signup for their free 'Members Card' and save lots too! Use it just for the trip as we did and throw it when done if you don't have a Safeway back home. We bought lots of breakfast and dinner foods (although fresh fruits can be purchased cheaper than the grocery at any of the roadside stands around town) and we enjoyed saving dinner dollars by eating in. Our budgeting meant we were able to take in more activities for the same dollars as paying for expensive restaurant meals. We enjoyed fresh Maui fish with all the extras one night for 1/3 the cost of the same meal at any of the hotel restaurants. For quick and very reasonable meals, you can't beat CJ's Comfort Zone located about 100 yards from the main entrance to the Eldo - right in the little strip mall facing the highway. Great home-cooked food, super prices (especially for Maui), and a nifty atmosphere. Ask around for some of their coupons for 50% off the price on a second meal ordered (we found ours at the Expedia booth on Front street in Lahiana). Is was nice for our two teens to walk over for a shake or burger (great burgers!) for under $10 a meal. We also enjoyed the pizza and starters at BJ's Pizza in Lahaina - we ate and watched the harbor action ocean-side from their second story location right on Front street. We took in lots of various activities - * surfing: use one of the many surf schools right on the harbor beach in Lahaina for the best pricing and friendly instructors. Best prices will be had if purchased when in Maui - preferably right in Lahaina. * snorkeling: we choose the Pacific Whale Foundation "deluxe" trip for stops at both Molokini and a secondary locale for snorkeling. The big appeal for us - and most of the people on these trips - is the time taken to locate dolphins during the trip. We were able to locate and boat with a pod of 12-13 dolphins that included 2 babies. They even 'surfed' with our catamaran for a while! We also saw loads of great fish, sea turtles (3 species), and beautiful corals and underwater sites. The provided food was excellent and the well-trained staff super. Highly Recommend the PWF packages. * sunrise bike ride on Haleakala: if this is of interest to you, do it early in your trip! We did this our second day and it was great despite having to get up at 2:15 AM. Hey, when else are you gonna' be able to do this sort of thing? ;-) We asked around and used the Mountain Riders organization. Nice bikes, very friendly guides, good vans, and best-price packages (ask for a multiple-rider discount if you have more than 3 in your party). The sunrise was spectacular our morning and the brief stop at the summit observatory was a nifty bonus. The stop for breeakfast was very welcomed and the food was excellent. * horseback riding: we used the Mendez Ranch and all I can say is WOW! The BEST setup, the BEST people, the BEST horses, and the BEST views and riding environment hands-down. Moderate prices, but well worth the littel extra. Great BBQ lunch after the morning ride too if you're interested. Ride first in the morning, have lunch with the cowboys, and then stop at Iao State Park on the way home. A great day! * beach time: You can't beat the beachside Cabana right at the Eldo! Seriously, the Kaanapali beach is the best on Maui by any standards and the Eldo is smack in the middle of the best section. Great for swimming, boogie boarding, snorkeling (especially right nearby around the 'black rock'), and loads of sunbathing and beachwalking opportunities. We also checked out the beaches south of Lahaina for more surfing (rented a board) and snorkeling (also rented equipment - $9 a week per set!). You won't be dissapointed with the Eldorado, the beaches, or the vacation memories on Maui! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at the El Dorado. We wanted a quiet spacious place away from the "hotel" scene but still close to the beach and the action when we wanted to go there. The suites were spacious, clean, a bit dated but very comfortable. We would go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great family lodging option!”
Reviews.Author: cherylfabry
Reviews.Content: Just got back from almost two weeks in Maui and LOVED the Maui Outrigger Eldorado. Since we were staying so long, we couldn't afford to spend $300-400/night plus we needed separate rooms when sleeping for privacy. The Eldorado was the perfect hotel. We stayed in unit E202, a lovely clean air-conditioned one-bedroom with two queen beds and sofa sleeper, kitchen with dishes, utensils, pots & pans, full sized refrigerator - just like being at home. Large bathroom (no bathtub) and daily maid service for $176/night. The staff was really helpful and pleasant. Downside: 5-10 minute walk to beach, uncomfortable beach backrests and long wait for complimentary golf cart ride from beach to hotel room but these were inconsequential considering what we saved in price and gained in comfort. HIGHLY RECOMMEND: ** Four Winds II trip to Molokini Crater for snorkeling (lots of food, fabulously helpful and friendly crew, two whole hours at crater, glass bottom boat and slide into water for kids - and adults!), ** Horseback ride into Haleakala (views are phenomenal!), ** Road to Hana (plan to spend the night in Hana to see all the signts along the way and travel back along the southern, supposedly impassable, route - roads are very passable), ** Trip to island of Lanai (take boat ride from Expeditions and rent an old jalopy from Lanai Eco Tours - they let you travel to more places on the island than Dollar will let you go)

Reviews.Title: “Good time at the Eldo”
Reviews.Author: huboon
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hawai'i. It was also our first time staying in a condo, so we weren't quite sure what to expect. We booked it as part of a flight/hotel/car package through Expedia. It turned out we loved every minute of it. We were in room E207, which had an ocean view (even though we had only paid for a "garden view") and all the amenities of home including a full kitchen with dishes. This saved buck$ by eating breakfast at "home" each day. It was a nice surprise having a washer and dryer in our room. If we'd known that ahead of time we would have packed less clothing. Oh well, at least I was able to wear my favorite clothes over and over again. The staff were helpful, even offering to lend us a CD for the drive around the east side of the island through Hana. The only complaint I have is barely worth mentioning-- the toilet was a little off balance-- it rocked back and forth if you moved while sitting on the throne. So unless you are wealthy, spoiled and expecting a five-star hotel, you will have a great time at the Eldo.

HotelInfo.Name: Outrigger Maui Eldorado
HotelInfo.Address: 2661 Keka'a Drive, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
